With the majority of people in the village at the time of the fire being children and aged, it was difficult to halt the fire thereby resulting in major damage.

A detailed assessment of the fire-affected community is underway, and the result of the assessment will provide information on the comprehensive damage level and the affected households' needs. Nevertheless, Staff and volunteers in GBRCS branches were robust in conducting a rapid assessment to provide initial information on the level of damage and urgent needs. The victims of the fire outbreak currently reside with neighbours in the exact location while they attempt to rebuild their shelters. They desperately need shelter repairs, food, and non-food items. Other needs include sanitation and livelihood recovery.

name: TZA: Insect Infestation - 2023-01 - measles outbreak
summary: According to the government report and request Mbimbwe District at Katavi region in Tanzania affected by measles at large area and more than 300 cases corfimed and 8 death reported of children under 5 year and the number increases day after day. Per the World Health Organisdation (WHO) and The nUnited States Center of Desease Control and prevention (CDC), there ia  a 79% increase in measles cases across the world.

name: ARG: Incendio - 2023-01 - Incendio forestal en San Miguel
summary:
Desde principios de año distintas provincias de la Argentina se encuentran afectadas por focos de incendios que, por lo general, suelen controlarse o extinguirse en 24 a 72Hs.; los mismos tienen distinto origen pero la causa principal de tanta actividad está asociada al periodo de sequia reinante en el país, principalmente en el centro y norte del mismo. 

En la tarde de hoy el Comité de Crisis Ignea de la Provincia de Corrientes reportó un incendio de consideración y fuera de control, con posible afectación de interface (posibilidad de que afecte viviendas) y con un humo potencialmente peligroso atento a la gran carga de recina producto de las especies comprometidas. 

Al cierre del presente informe diversas dotaciones de Bomberos se encuentran trabajando en el lugar, en tanto que se están movilizando recursos de atención sanitaria, incluyendo a personal de Cruz Roja Argentina. El evento se encuentra en pleno desarrollo motivo por el cual esta información será actualizada en base a la evolución del mismo.

name: SUR: Epidemic - 2023-01 - Suriname: Dengue outbreak 2023
summary:
Recently, an increase in the number of dengue cases has been observed in Suriname. Overall, there is also an increase in the number of reports throughout the region. In July, the Public Health Service (BOG) intensified dengue prevention activities by, among other things, increasing spraying activities. On August 24, 2023, Stephanie Cheuk-Alam, head of the Environmental Inspectorate of the Bureau of Public Health (BOG) reports in conversation with the Communication Service Suriname that the increase in dengue cases is partly due to the type 3 dengue that is now mainly going around.

“There are four different types of dengue and all four occur in Suriname, but at the moment it is mainly type 3 that is now being spread,” says the chief inspector. She indicates that this type of dengue virus was not present in Suriname for 21 years. That is, no one has been exposed to the virus for 21 years. Now a large part of the Surinamese population, especially young people under 20, is vulnerable to this type of dengue. The result of this is therefore an increase in the number of dengue cases.

Work is currently underway to identify the locations where the cases come from and to tackle them by means of spraying. “We are in a difficult situation now because the reporting from the doctors is not optimal,” says Cheuk-Alam. It is the intention that the dengue cases reported by the doctors are reported to the epidemiology department at the BOG. The various laboratories are being contacted to at least find out in which neighborhoods there are infections. The BOG tries to find out as much as possible if the infected people are from a certain neighbourhood, if it concerns a group that works in a place or a group of people who do not live together, but who became infected during a trip. This is because the intervention must take place systematically. The spray only kills the adult mosquitoes and frequent large-scale spraying increases the chance that the mosquito will become resistant to the product.

name: BDI: Épidémie - 2023-01 - Burundi: épidémie de choléra
summary: Tous les cas sont pris en charge au Centre de Traitement du Choléra sis dans l'hôpital Prince Régent Charles

name: URY: Otros - 2023-01 - Vientos Fuertes
summary:
El pasado primero de enero el Instituto Nacional Uruguayo de Meteorología (INUMET) emitió una alerta meteorológica de color amarillo para el área Metropolitana y el litoral norte.

En la tarde del primero de enero, una célula de tormenta aislada (tormenta ¨microdescentente¨ -corriente de aire muy fuerte que desciende de una nube de tormenta-  provoco caída de árboles, voladura de techos, daños en algunos comercios y pérdida de del servicio a 1.300 clientes de UTE (Administración Nacional de Usinas y Trasmisiones Eléctricas). Las zonas más afectadas fueron en el departamento de Montevideo, en los barrios Peñarol, Sayago y Prado.

El Instituto Uruguayo de Meteorología (Inumet), entre las 14:30 y las 15:30hs registró un acumulado de precipitación de 5,4mm.

Se alcanzaron rachas de viento de 80 km/h y en algunas zonas rachas de 100 km/h, la tormenta alcanzó su mayor intensidad sobre las 15:00hs.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Desde la tarde noche del primero de enero el CECOED (Centro Coordinador de Emergencias Departamentales) desplegó un operativo en las zonas más afectadas trabajando en el retiro de los árboles y ramas caídas que causaban cortes en la circulación vial.

 

 

De los más de 150 reclamos, 65 ya fueron resueltos por los equipos del CECOED y el Municipio G.

countries society-name: The Sri Lanka Red Cross Society
name: Sri Lanka - Population Movement
summary:
Several boats reportedly set off from Bangladesh between 25-27 November 2022, carrying displaced people from Rakhine, Myanmar. Based on previous movements and established routes, it is assumed that the intended destination was either Malaysia or Indonesia. According to UNHCR, a boat carrying 105 people was rescued by the Sri Lanka Navy in Trincomalee harbour on the country's eastern coast, on 18 December and disembarked on 20 December. When the boat ran into engine trouble in rough seas, it was suspected that it was on its way to Indonesia. The Sri Lanka Navy first detected the boat when it was 3.5 nautical miles (6.5km) from the shore. After the legal proceedings, they were transferred to Jaffna Prison in the country's north. According to Sri Lanka's immigration officials, the arrivals were transferred to an immigration detention camp in the Colombo suburbs on 22 December 2022.

Following a field assessment by the Sri Lanka Red Cross Society (SLRCS)/International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) team, it has been confirmed that the Sri Lanka Navy has received 105 displaced people from Rakhine, Myanmar, including 49 children (21 girls, 28 boys) and 56 adults (26 females, 30 males). Furthermore, 21 unaccompanied children (8 boys, 13 girls) and 1 elderly person (68 years) were identified among the arrivals, but no person with disability (PWD) was identified. Due to their deteriorating health, three of the arrivals (2 children, 1 woman) are admitted to the hospital. The language barrier has been identified as the most significant barrier to communicating with the displaced people in order to comprehend the situation.

name: MYS: Other - 2022-12 - Tidal Wave
summary:
More than 200 victims were reportedly affected as 105 houses collapsed due to the waves during the high tide phenomenon that occurred in Kampung Forest and Kampung Tinusa Dua on 23/12/2022. 

According to Malaysian Fire and Rescue Department Operations Center(JBPM PGO), the tidal wave phenomenon happened around 10pm and all the victims were evacuated in the temporary evacuation center of Sungai Anib Dua National School (SMK). Estimated around 100 houses collapsed in Kampung Forest while 500 other houses were threatened in the same incident. In addition, five more houses also collapsed in Kampung Tinusa Dua and another 20 were reported to be threatened.

name: SLE: Fire - 2022-12 - Freetown Fire Incident
summary: A large fire incident occurred on December 25, 2022 (Christmas Day) in one of the Sierra Leone Red Cross Society program communities – England Ville Community, Funkia, Goderich in the Western Rural district. According to the community-based volunteers, the incident began around 12:30 pm with a lady who was preparing her Christmas meal in a makeshift house. Immediate household members were unable to put out the fire and the National Fire Force could not get there on time to extinguish the blaze as the fire truck was involved in a fatal accident on its way to the fire scene. However, the entire community population came together to put out the fire, but this was when several houses have been burnt, households displaced, warehouses and stalls burnt down, fish drying houses constructed and managed mostly by women destroyed, resident women petty traders and hawkers lost their livelihoods to the fire. Displaced persons have no place to stay, and the neighborhood cannot contain the population displaced. The majority of the victims sleep in the open, few have moved to nearby public buildings such as markets and schools, and others stay on the unsafe beaches in and around Goderich Village.

name: MYS: Population Movement - 2022-12 - Andaman Sea boat arrivals
summary: Between 25-27 November 2022, two to four boats reportedly set off from Bangladesh. We assume that they were headed to either Malaysia or Indonesia as has been the case in the past. News reports on 9 December indicate that one boat was rescued by a Vietnamese vessel and handed over to the Myanmar authorities. One boat with 160 passengers is reportedly stranded in the Andaman Sea. It is alleged that the boat is located within the Malaysian Search and Rescue (SAR) region. The last known location of this boat on 9 December via a satellite phone on the boat was approximately 388 km from Ranong, Thailand, 352 km from Port Blair, India, and 619 km from Langkawi, Malaysia. The boat has reportedly broken down and they have been without food or water for an untold number of days. The location and condition of the two other boats are yet unknown

name: MYS: Landslide - 2022-12 - Batang Kali Landslide
summary:
In the early morning of Friday 16 December 2022 at 2.30 am, a large landslide occured in  at a camping site in Batang kali, Selangor. According to the Director of the Malaysian Fire and Rescue Department (JBPM) Selangor, Datuk Norazam Khamis, JBPM received an emergency call at 2.24am before moving their personnel and assets to the scene of the incident. About 69 people are feared trapped and buried in a landslide that occurred and based on PDRM preliminary information, there were 100 people at the campsite who may have fallen victim to the landslide.

The Search and Rescue Operation (SAR) has involved various agencies such as Malaysian Fire and Rescue special team STORM, SMART team, Malaysian Civil Defence (APM), Malaysian Military Force (ATM) and Ministry of Health and other agencies.

SAR Operation were halt at 10pm due to the rain by Head of Operation from Fire and Rescue Department and continued the next day 17th December at 8am.

Latest update 19/12/2022, entering the fourth day, the search and rescue (SAR) operation for nine remaining victims missing in the landslide tragedy at the Fathers' Organic Farm campsite, Gohtong Jaya, Batang Kali here continues today. Director of the Fire and Rescue Department and Selangor Datuk Norazam Khamis when contacted by Bernama said his side will focus on Sector A (Hillview) and Sector C (Riverside) as well as the surrounding areas that have not been excavated.

name: Ethiopia - Tigray Crisis
summary:
In November 2022, the two parties, GoE and TPLF, signed an agreement on permanent cessation of hostilities to end the two-year-long conflict including the protection of civilians’ human rights, the resumption of public services in the region, the unobstructed flow of humanitarian supplies to Tigray, and facilitation of the return of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and refugees to the region.

Following the signature of the Agreement, humanitarian access to Tigray has improved, allowing the Ethiopian Red Cross Society to complete an assessment shared on 15th March 2023 and demonstrating the critical need to scale up assistance in newly accessible areas. This assessment is a basis to inform immediate action to save lives through provision of humanitarian assistance but also to build confidence with local communities and returnees, authorities, and donors that assistance can be sustained at scale.

name: GTM: Terremoto - 2022-12 - Enjambre Sísmico en Guatemala
summary:
Durante las últimas 24 horas se han registrado más de 47 sismos, de los cuales 3 han sido sensibles y que se han originado en el departamento de Guatemala (Insivumeh). Las magnitudes revisadas oscilan entre 1.0 y 3.2, con profundidad de 10 kilómetros. 

Según el Servicio Sismológico de Guatemala, estos sismos pueden estar asociados a fallas locales del graben de Guatemala, ambiente tectónico en donde son comunes los enjambres sísmicos.

name: MOZ: Epidemic - 2022-12 - Cholera outbreak
summary: On the 15th of Dec 2022 the Government of Mozambique reportedly announced the confirmation of the Cholera outbreak in the districts of Lichinga and Lago in the Niassa province. A number of 409 were confirmed with 7 reported deaths as of 21 Dec 2022. Niassa Province is bordering Malawi, that has been battling Cholera outbreak for over five months. In late September, a cholera outbreak was declared in Lago district in Mozambique which borders Malawi (through Lake Malawi also known as Lake Nyasa). Shortly, cases started to be reported in the neighbouring district of Lichinga. According to the Niassa health authorities Daily Bulletin issued on 8th January 2023, there were 379 cholera confirmed cases and 6 deaths in Lago, while in Lichinga district the cumulative confirmed cases were 250 with 2 death reported. The surge in cases and cross-border movements risk the spread of cholera to neighbouring countries including Mozambique. The upcoming rainy season further poses a threat of disease spreading nation-wide.

countries society-name: Red Cross of the Democratic Republic of the Congo
name: COD: Inondation - 2022-12 - Les inondations dans la ville de Kinshasa
summary:
Les pluies diluvienne qui se sont abattues dans la ville de Kinshasa le mardi 13 décembre de 2 heures jusqu’à 7 heures 30 du matin ont causé des inondations par la suite débordement des rivières qui traversent la ville.

Ces inondations ont cause des dégâts matériels et humains importants notamment l’écroulement partiels et total des maisons dans 16 communes de la ville de Kinshasa avec perte en vies humaines.

Une évaluation rapide a été menée par les volontaires secouristes, qui nous permis d’obtenir les données suivant.

name: COG: Inondation - 2022-12 - Inondation
summary:
Etant encore en pleine saison de pluie dans ce dernier trimestre de l'année en cours,  il est possible que le niveau des 'eaux monte à nouveau et s'étende à d'autres localités qui conduira à une extension des zones inondées. Notons que rivières ne seront pas dégagées et les inondations s'étendront dans toutes les localités à risque dans les trois départements cibles. Aussi il y a un très grand risque que les maladies transmises par l'eau (choléra, malaria, fièvre jaune) prennent de l'ampleur. Compte tenu du contexte qui se présente, le risque de propagation des maladies d'origine hydrique, qui se composent de maladies fécales-orales, de maladies liées à l'eau et de maladies aquatiques, est très élevé.
Les points d'eau et latrines détruits ou inondés augmentent le manque d'accès à l'eau potable dans les départements ciblés. Ceci expose la population affectée aux épidémies et aux maladies bucco-buccales, notamment le choléra, qui s'est propagé ces dernières années dans différents districts des deux départements (Cuvette et Plateaux).
Compte tenu de l'importance de la population dans ces trois départements, il est essentiel de prendre des mesures pour garantir leur accès à une eau potable (par exemple, par la distribution de produits de potabilisation pour le traitement de l'eau et de conteneurs de stockage), ainsi que pour gérer les épidémies (par exemple, la distribution de sachets de SRO). La situation actuelle des eaux stagnantes est très propice à la culture des vecteurs du paludisme.

name: SDN: Population Movement - 2022-12 - Influx of South Sudan refugees
CHL: Incendio - 2022-12 - Incendio Forestal
summary:
Durante el día 11 de diciembre la oficina nacional de emergencias del ministerio del interior (ONEMI) declara alerta roja por incendios forestales en las comunas de Melipilla y San Pedro (Región Metropolitana), Viña del Mar y Quinteros (Región de Valparaiso), y San clemente, Romeral y Curicó (Región del Maule). estos son parte de los incendios que son de mayor preocupación por su cercania a zonas pobladas y rapido avance del fuego, según informan las autoridades se ha visto afectación de casas siniestradas debido al incedio y se a activado la alerta por mensajeria SAE (Sistema de alerta de emergencia) en las parcelaciones bosque Santa Cecilia hacia praderas de codihua, se evacuaron los sectores de Mandinga, altos de Popeta, San Juan de Popeta, Callejón Ovejería en la comuna de Melipilla.

En la comuna de Melipilla se estiman 40 viviendas afectadas, alteración en la conectividad en la ruta G-60. se han previsto de albergues para las personas evacuadas y afectadas 

Quinteros se reportaron 3 viviendas destruidas, 4 con daño menor y 2 viviendas y un galpon destruidos en la comuna de quillota.

en la actualidad se prevé que el incedio que afecta en la comuna de quinteros se extienda a la comuna de quillota. 

El sistema de

name: GTM: Volcanic Eruption - 2022-12 - Erupcion Volcán de Fuego
summary:
El Insivumeh ha declarado que el volcán de Fuego ha entrado en actividad estromboliana, con explosiones débiles, moderadas y fuertes. Las columnas de ceniza tienen altura de 5, 000 metros sobre el nivel del mar y material incandescente de 500 metros.

https://insivumeh.gob.gt/?p=66593

countries society-name: The Red Cross Society of Bosnia and Herzegovina
name: BIH: Flood - 2022-12 - Flood
summary:
On Saturday 10.12.2022. after heavy rainfall in certain places in the territory of the of Bosnia and Herzegovina, rivers overflowed, which in the afternoon and then in the evening began to cause problems for local infrastructure, facilities and citizens. Almost all cantons in the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina are facing rising river levels and possible overflows. The situation in similar also in the Republic of Srpska.

Currently, the most threatened area in Federation of BiH is the Una-Sana canton, where rivers have overflowed in all municipalities and cities. Among the most critical are the municipality of Sanski Most, where a state of natural disaster has been declared, and the City of Bihać.

Immediately after realising the situation on the ground, the Red Cross of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina made contact with the Red Cross organizations in the Una-Sana Canton, and according to the Standard Operating Procedures for the Rapid Response for the Red Cross FBiH structure, the Form for initial reporting of the accident to all Red Cross cantonal organizations of the Red Cross was launched. The form was sent to the Red Cross organizations of the Tuzla, Posavina, Zenica-Doboj, Central Bosnia, West-Herzegovina and Herzegovina-Neretva cantons, as well as all municipal and city Red Cross organizations within the Red Cross of the Una-Sana canton.

The Red Cross of the Una-Sana Canton activated the Protection and Rescue Service, and in cooperation with the staff of the Red Cross of the city of Bihać, went to the field in order to assess the situation and initial needs, and distributed drinking water to the citizens. A quantity of boots and dehumidifiers have also been prepared and will be distributed tomorrow (Monday, December 12, 2022).

During the day, on 11 December 2022 at 14:00, the Red Cross of the Municipality of Sanski Most delivered the first initial information with a cross-section of the situation as follows:

  • The secretary of the Red Cross of Sanski Most municipality made contact with the headquarters of the Civil Protection 
  • Established contact with the president of local communities
  • 10 volunteers and 3 professionals were hired for field support
  • According to initial estimates, the rivers Bliha and Zdena overflowed in the narrower part of the city as well as in the surrounding towns in MZ: Gornji Kamengrad, Donji Kamengrad, Fajtovci, Vrse, Husimovci, as well as in the area of ​​Stari Majdan and Novi Naselje. The overflowing of the Željeznica and Gračanica rivers flooded between 5 and 10 households
  • About 20 households and 30 auxiliary facilities are located in the most threatened area, for which it is planned to provide food and hygiene packages.
  • Power outage and availability of potable water

Video Red Cross Sanski Most branch

https://fb.watch/hlp9T3si6F/

Links:

Teška noć u Sanskom Mostu: Izlile se dvije rijeke, grad poplavljen, oglasile se sirene za uzbunu (klix.ba)

 

Zabilježeno je vanredno hidrološko stanje na području slivova rijeka Une i Save (klix.ba)

Following the data from the Federal Civil Protection the situation is:

Una-Sana canton

City of Bihać: the water level of the Una river was 162 cm (the critical point is 100 cm), the water levels along the entire Una course are relatively high and exceed the critical points. Local communities in the area of ​​the city of Bihać reported floods in which there are dozens of flooded residential and auxiliary buildings. 

Municipality of Sanski Most: On the proposal of the Civil Protection, the municipal mayor declared a state of natural disaster. The Bliha River overflowed its banks in several places, endangering citizens and their property more and more. At one point, the concrete dam in the bed of the Bliha river broke, after which there was an uncontrolled expansion of the river flow, so that half an hour after the dam burst, two streams of the Bliha and Zdena rivers came together, and a large number of residential buildings remained under water in a short period of time . The water flooded a large number of buildings along the courses of these two rivers and in the area of ​​the local communities of Zdena, Husimovci, Vrše, Donji Kamengrad, Hatiraj, Gornji Kamnegrad, Fajtovci and Novo Naselje and Stari Majdan from the river Majdanuša. In the late evening hours, the water came into the city itself. Road communications Sanski Most - Stari Majdan, S. Most - Fajtovci in Kamengrad, Husimovci and Fajtovci and several local roads in the city are also threatened by the flood. 

City of Bosanska Krupa: A total of nine residential buildings were flooded, six houses in Bosanska Otoka, two residential buildings in the town of Svetinja, and one store in the city center. 

Municipality of Bosanski Petrovac: In the past 24 hours, the fire department had 20 technical interventions to pump out water from residential buildings. During the night, the most critical was in Donji Bišćani, Nukići and Bahići.

The city of Cazin: Yesterday, during the day, the fire department of the city of Cazin had four technical interventions to pump out water from the yard, and there were no reports of flooding during the night.

Municipality of Bužim: The situation is normalizing, the water is receding from the flooded areas, there were no reports of flooding during the night.

Municipality of Ključ: The Sanica River overflowed in a couple of places on agricultural land, there are no endangered buildings.

Municipality of Velika Kladuša: The rivers Kladušnica and Grabarska have swelled and flooded the coastal area, but there are no reports of buildings being threatened.

Zenica-Doboj canton

Rijeka Bosna is increasing (mostly in the cities: ​​Visoko, Kakanj, Zenica, Žepča, Maglaj)

Posavina Canton

The water level of the Sava River is rising along its entire course.

Tuzla canton

According to current information in the area of ​​Tuzla Canton, the water level at the HA Modrac dam at 07:00 this morning was 197.56 m.a.s.l. (with an overflow point of 200 m.a.s.l.) and is higher by 12 cm compared to the measurements 24 hours ago. The rivers in ​​Živinice and Gračanica are increasing.

West Herzegovina Canton and Herzegovina-Neretva Canton

The Trebižat River at the Humac water measuring station this morning at 8:00 a.m. was 309 cm (280 cm regular flood defense)

Central Bosnia Canton

 

Vrbas river in slight increase.

countries society-name: The South African Red Cross Society
name: ZAF: Flood - 2022-12 - Flash Floods in Gauteng and North West Province
summary:
Parts of Gauteng province and North West province were negatively affected by the recent floods that hit hardest areas like parts of Soweto, Johannesburg, Vereeniging, Brakpan  and Bojanala in the North west Province on Saturday the 10th   and the 11th of December 2022. This followed media release by South African Weather Service (SAWS) on Friday the 9th of December 2022. https://www.weathersa.co.za/Documents/Corporate/Medrel_9_December_HD_09122022132545.pdf

South African Red Cross Society (SARCS) intensifies dissemination of early warning messages to at risk communities. Although dissemination efforts were done to minise the impact of floods to at risk communities the average rainfall which the province have been receiving the past week resulted in soil saturation. This resulted in flash floods as there was more water run-off with minimum drainage

Following the joint rapid assessments coordinated by Gauteng and North West Provincial Disaster Management Centres (PDMCs) in collaboration with other government sector Departments which include Department of Social Development (DSD), Department of Home Affairs, South Africa Social Service Agency (SASSA) and South African Red Cross Society (SARCS) revealed that so far 3826 households have affected (3326 in Gauteng and 500 in North West) and about 10 000 people have been displaced. The affected people have been evacuated to safer areas which include community halls and educational centres. The mostly affected areas like Kliptown, Protea South, Bram fisher, Nancefield Hostel and Lenasia in Soweto, Alexandra in Johannesburg and Bojanala in North West are currently cut off from electricity connection and infrastructure like roads to connect them to markets are flooded. The Joint Operations Coordination (JOC) team in the district has been activated.

name: URY: Sequía - 2022-12 - Sequías y ola de calor
summary:
Desde el mes de octubre el Ministerio de Ganaderia Agricultura y Pesca (MGAP) decretó la emergencia agropecuaria para todos aquellos productores que se vieran afectados por la actual sequía.

 

El Instituto Uruguayo de Meteorología (INUMET) prevee que la precipitación acumulada esperada para diciembre-enero-febrero es inferior a lo normal. En particular, para la región norte y noroeste de Uruguay se espera un 45% de probabilidad en el tercil inferior, 35% en el medio y 20% en el superior, mientras que en el resto del país se prevé un 40% de probabilidad en el tercil inferior, 35% en el medio y 25% en el superior.

 

A su vez, se pronostican temperatura media trimestral en la mayoría del país sea superior a lo normal, con una probabilidad de ubicarse en el tercil superior de 45 %, y una probabilidad de 35% de ubicarse en el tercil medio y 20% de tercil inferior.

 

A raíz de esta situación, se han detectado casos de desabastecimiento hídrico en algunas localidades, la falta de lluvias provocó un profundo déficit hídrico en Florida donde el Centro Coordinador de Emergencias Departamentales (CECOED) debió suministrar más de 2.000.000 litros de agua y hay unas 100 familias afectadas a raíz de que los pozos de agua que suministran las viviendas de la zona se han secado.

 

Por otro lado, se están detectando diversos incendios e incendios forestales en todo el territorio, la Dirección Nacional de Bomberos y el Instituto Nacional de Meteorología (INUMET) emitieron un aviso especial informando a la población que todo el territorio se encuentra en riesgo muy alto de incendios e incendios forestales según el indice FWI (Fire Weather Index).

name: COL: Derrumbe - 2022-12 - Movimiento en masa
summary:
En la madrugada del domingo 4 de diciembre se registró un fuerte deslizamiento de tierra de grandes proporciones que generó una emergencia en la vía que conduce del municipio de Pueblo Rico, en Risaralda, hacia el departamento del Chocó. De acuerdo con el reporte de las autoridades, un bus de transporte público que cubría la ruta Cali - Condoto, quedó atrapado en el alud de tierra con 31 pasajeros a bordo.

Según el Servicio Geológico Colombiano (SGC), el municipio de Pueblo Rico, está en amenaza muy alta por movimiento en masa, esta condición asociada al fenómeno de La Niña, que se presenta desde agosto del 2020, ha generado hipersaturacion en materiales con alto grado de metamorfismo, además asociado a pendientes abruptas, que han desencadenado movimientos en masa superficiales, con un volumen movilizado en el orden de 5.000 a 10.000 metros cúbicos aproximadamente según cálculos preliminares.

name: ZWE: Drought Protocol
summary:
The IFRC Disaster Response Emergency Fund (DREF) has approved a total of CHF 549,318.00 for the Zimbabwe Red Cross Society’s Early Action Protocol on droughts. The approved amount consists of an allocation of CHF 182,440 for readiness and CHF 366,878 allocated to implement early actions once the defined triggers are met. Allocations are made from the Anticipatory Pillar of the DREF, under the DREF appeal code MDR00001. Unearmarked contributions to the DREF are encouraged to guarantee enough funding is available for the Early Action Protocols being developed. The Drought Early Action Protocol (EAP) for the Zimbabwe Red Cross Society (ZRCS) is a tool to guide the timely and effective implementation of early actions based on forecast and observational data, which predict meteorological hazards with a high likelihood of humanitarian impact. Drought (Meteorological and Agricultural) is the most common and high-impact natural hazard occurring in Zimbabwe, both in terms of frequency of occurrence and the number of people affected, with droughts accounting for 7 out of the 10 top major natural hazards since recorded 1990. Due to increasing climatic uncertainty, and reduced coping capacity, the risk of drought has spread to all areas of the country and is affecting a broader range of people, in both urban and rural areas. Furthermore, the impacts of this hazard are predicted to increase, with the World Bank Group Climate Change Knowledge Portal, predicting the annual likelihood of Zimbabwe encountering severe drought to increase by 21% in 2040 to 2059 and by 47% in 2080 to 2099 compared to the baseline period of 1986 to 2005 scenario. 

At a national scale, droughts often result in crop failure, loss of livestock and wildlife, and power outages. The country’s worst drought occurred in 1991/2, directly affecting 5 million people and resulting in serious food insecurity and water shortages which had a ripple effect on the Southern African region compromising food security in countries that were reliant on Zimbabwe’s food exports. Repeated drought exposure has entrenched vulnerabilities and reduced the coping capacities of small-scale farmers, leaving an increasing number of people who are affected by the impacts of drought. This EAP has been developed through extensive consultation with key informants, at the community, district, and National levels, and has been supported by technical guidance from the 510 Data initiative and the Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre. The monitoring of the hazard and the implementation of the Early Actions will be led by the ZRCS, guided by relevant Government of Zimbabwe (GoZ) departments, including the Agricultural Extension Department, the Veterinary Department, and the Meteorological Services Department. This EAP has also been developed with close reference to the Government of Zimbabwe National Drought Plan and aligns the identified roles of the Zimbabwe Red Cross and other stakeholders. Technical and financial support for the development of this EAP has been provided by the Danish Red Cross and Finnish Red Cross Societies.

name: CMR: Landslide - 2022-11 - Eboulement de terrain quartier Damas à Yaoundé
summary: Ce 27 Novembre 2022, alors que des populations étaient dans la célébration des funérailles d'un des leurs sur une aire de jeu du quartier Damas dans le 3ème Arrondissement de Yaoundé, un pan abrupte asse important de terres'est détaché et s'est renversé sur la tente qui abritait les invités. Ils se sont ainsi retrouvés pris au piège à la fois de la bâche et de la terre. La population attirée par les cris a commencé à procéder à un sauvetage à qui mieux mieux. Malheureusement, malgré les efforts des riverains, plusieurs personnes n'ont pas pu être sauvées. Alertés les secours (Gendarmeries, Police Croix-Rouge Camerounaise et le Corps National des Sapeurs Pompiers) se sont rendus sur les lieux pour une meilleures organisation des secours. Après le sauvetage, les recherches se sont poursuivies jusque tard dans la nuit. Les recherches qui se sont terminées au petit matin du 28 Novembre 2022 ont données un bilan officiel de 14 morts et près d'une cinquantaine de blessés. Les corps ont été acheminés grace aux ambulances de la Croix-Rouge et du SAMU vers la morgue tandis que les blessés ont été admis dans les formations sanitaires les plus proches pour la prise en charge.

countries society-name: Red Crescent Society of the Republic of Kazakhstan
name: KAZ: Other - 2022-11 - Termination of the thermal power plant
summary:
Due to the large consumption of mains water in heating systems 

On 27.11.2022 , there was a stop of boilers at the TPS of Ekibastuz.

In this connection, 689 multi-storey residential buildings, 5672 residential private houses, 1205 others were transferred to reduced heat supply. 

Of these, in order to minimize the defrosting of the internal heating system, heating networks were emptied in 149 multi-storey, 114 private houses and 15 social facilities in mkrn. 5A, 5B and 6, the population of 44,178 people.

As of 11.00 a.m. on 11/29/2022, 6 boilers No. 6,8,9,12,14,15 are in operation; 4 boilers (No. 5,7,11,13) are in reserve. The supply of mains water has been reduced from 1200 tons/hour to 800 (at a rate of 400). Heat supply has been restored in 132 multi-storey,

114 private houses and 13 social facilities in mkrn. 5A, 5B and 6, 17 multi-storey residential buildings, 2 educational facilities and 1 administrative building remain disconnected from central heating.

Akim of Ekibastuz declared an emergency of a technogenic nature on a local scale (decision No. 3 of 11/28/2022). A hotline was opened in Pavlodar and Ekibastuz, 1125 calls were received. The regional operational headquarters is deployed in the Emergency Situation Room. 123 people (39 adults, 84 children) were evacuated from the city of Ekibastuz to Pavlodar.

In total, 152 people and 40 pieces of equipment are involved in emergency recovery work. Since November 28, the educational facilities of Ekibastuz have switched

to a distance learning format. Kindergartens will not work until further notice.

According to the RSE "Kazhydromet" on November 29 this year in Ekibastuz, the air temperature will be 20-250C in the afternoon, the wind is south-easterly 5-10 m/s, without precipitation.

name: ECU: Volcanic Eruption - 2022-11 - Actividad Volcánica Cotopaxi
summary:
Antecedente

El Volcán Cotopaxi se encuentra ubicado sobre la Cordillera Oriental (Real), a una distancia de 35 km al Noreste de Latacunga y de 45 km al Sureste de Quito, el volcán Cotopaxi ha presentado cinco grandes períodos eruptivos: 1532-1534, 1742-1744, 1766-1768, 1853-1854 y 1877-1880. La peligrosidad del volcán Cotopaxi radica en que sus erupciones, pueden dar lugar a la formación de enormes lahares, que transitarían por drenajes vecinos a zonas densamente pobladas, como el Valle Interandino entre Mulaló y Latacunga, y una parte del Valle de los Chillos. Aproximadamente 300.000 personas viven en zonas amenazadas por lahares (Loreto, Pedregal, La Caldera, Rumipamba, Bocatoma, El Ejido de Sangolquí) Adicionalmente, la caída de ceniza producida durante una erupción del Cotopaxi, podría afectar una parte muy significativa de la Sierra y la Costa del Ecuador lo que traería grandes consecuencias para la economía del país.

Actualidad

• El día sábado 26 de noviembre de 2022, se generó una emisión de ceniza y gases de aproximadamente 803 metros sobre el nivel del cráter, la dirección del viento hacía el norte hace que la ceniza se dirija la provincia de Pichincha, este evento se determinó mediante el satélite GOES-16 y a través de las cámaras ubicadas en puntos estratégicos del Instituto Geofísico, se han recibido reportes de caída de ceniza en los cantones Mejía y Quito.

Cantón Quito (14 parroquias)

Quitumbe, Guamaní, Amaguaña,La Argelia, San Juan, Centro Histórico, La Mena, Conocoto, Chillogallo, La Ecuatoriana, La Ferroviaria, Itchimbia, Solanda y San Bartolo 

Cantón Mejía (5 parroquias)

Tambillo, Uyumbicho, Machachi, Cutuglahua y Alóag

countries society-name: The Trinidad and Tobago Red Cross Society
name: Trinidad and Tobago: Floods
summary: On Friday 25th November 2022 at 6pm the Trinidad and Tobago Met Services issued a Adverse Weather Alert #1 with effect from Saturday 26th to Sunday 27th November 2022. On Saturday 27th in the early morning hours Trinidad began experiencing significant rainfall which was concentrated in the northern part of the island. Compounding weeks of constant rainfall which have caused ground level saturation and many major watercourses are already filled. Several communities along the east-west corridor began experiencing street and flash flooding. By Saturday afternoon, the Caroni River began to burst its banks in some areas causing riverine flooding in Bamboo #2, Valsayn South, Real Spring Gardens, Kelly Village, Madras Road and El Carmen, St. Helena. Into Saturday night and Sunday morning additional rainfall continued increasing the levels of water in these communities. Several roadways have been damaged as a result of undermining. On Sunday the Adverse Weather Alert Orange Level and a Riverine Flood Alert Organge Level was issued as additional rainfall was forecasted. Five major watercourses were flagged for concern including the Caroni River, North Oropouche River, South Oropouche River, the Caparo River and the Ortoire River. The TTRCS has been on the ground monitoring the high-risk communities and determining next steps. On Sunday 27th the Ministry of Education has issued a notice that all schools in Trinidad were to remain closed on Monday 28th November. Three shelters have been opened, and an emergency Cabinet Meeting was also called to plan a state-wide response.

name: ITA: Landslide - 2022-11 - Ischia Landslide
summary:
Due to heavy rains, a wide number of micro-landslides resulted in a debris flow that hit Casamicciola Terme, a town on Ischia island, in Campania Region.
The event hit an area with about 2000 inhabitants, causing the evacuation of 230 people, 8 deaths and 4 missing persons

name: TUR: Earthquake - 2022-11 - 5.9 Mw. Gölyaka Düzce
summary: A 5.6 Mw earthquake has occured in Gölyaka, Turkey at 04:30 A.M. The earthquake has been effective in the nearby provinces including İstanbul and Ankara. There has been no losses of life, moderate and heavy damage has been reported so far. Information has been received that 30 people have been injured and are being treated. Electricity shortage is currently experienced in the area.

name: GRC: Population Movement - 2022-11 - Rescue operation after Migrant Boat issues
summary:
Οn Tuesday afternoon a fishing boat, in which were on board about 400 to 500 people, was rescued during gale-force winds, and docked at Palaiochora, Crete. A Greek navy frigate, two cargo ships, a tanker, two Italian fishing boats and Hellenic Red Cross rescuers were dispatched to assist the vessel that was adrift in winds of over 30 kilometres (19 miles) an hour. There are no missing people. 
 
0 of 30 seconds, Volumn Tuesday after the fishing boat they were travelling on issued a distress signal off the island of Crete, the coast guard said. A spokesperson for the coast guard cited survivors as saying about 400 to 500 people were on board. Two cargo ships, one navy frigate and one tanker assisted in the rescue, which was hindered by near gale force winds in the area.

name: Indonesia: 5.6 M Earthquake in Cianjur, West Java
summary:
1. The earthquake with a magnitude scale of 5.6 RS occurred on 21 Nov 2022 at 13:21:10 WIB, located at 6.84 South Latitude, 107.05 East longitude at a depth of 10 Km.
  2. The tremors was felt strongly about 3 – 10 seconds across the affected areas including in Sukabumi district, Sukabumi City, Bandung district, Cianjur district, Bogor district, Bogor city, Jakarta, and Bekasi city.
  3. According to BMKG,  the earthquake did not trigger tsunami warning and has recorded 127 aftershocks, with biggest magnitude being 4.2 Richter scale and smallest being 1,5 Richter scale
  4. 3 most impacted areas are Cianjur district, Sukabumi district and Bogor District
  5. BNPB data as per 22 November the earthquake has resulted in 62 people casualties, displaced 13,784 people, and injured 326 people. About 5.405 are scattered in several evacuation points.  Final data on these impact are still ongoing.
  6. Impact to housing units and infrastructure  include damaged to 3.257 housing units, 4 health facilities, 14 educational facilities, 4 government buildings, 6 houses of worship, 2 bridge, and disrupted PLN Cianjur district (state-owned electricity company) affecting 358 sub-station and therefore services to 17,900 customers.
  7. Several roads have been cut off due to landslides.
  8. As the power grid went out, communications network are also disrupted.

name: Malaysia Floods 2022 (East Coast Monsoon)
summary:
The flood situation in the three states, namely Kelantan, Terengganu and Perak has worsened due to continuous rain, with more victims evacuated to relief centres. The Malaysian Meteorological Department (MetMalaysia) issued a danger-level weather alert early yesterday, with continuous heavy rain expected to occur across Terengganu and some areas in Kelantan from today until Tuesday. Meanwhile, severe-level continuous heavy rain is expected to occur in several areas in Kedah, Kelantan, Perak and Pahang during the same period, while an alert-level continuous rain notice has been issued for Perlis, Penang, as well as several areas in Kedah, Perak and Johor.

In KELANTAN, the number of flood victims increased to 8,820 people from 2627 families this morning compared to 6,549 people from 1,967 families last night at 10.25 p.m, involving 80 relief centres in seven districts, namely Kota Bharu, Pasir Mas, Tanah Merah, Pasir Puteh, Kuala Krai, Machang and Jeli.

In TERENGGANU, the number of flood-affected residents placed at relief centres increased sharply to 10,111 people from 3,007 families compared to 5,355 people from 1,576 families recorded last night. According to a statement from the State Disaster Management Committee (JPBN) Secretariat, 182 relief centres have been opened in six districts so far. Last two days, the Department of Irrigation and Drainage (JPS) in a statement warned that several areas in the districts of Kuala Terengganu, Besut, Setiu, Hulu Terengganu, Dungun and Kemaman were expected to be flooded from today based on its In flood forecasting model.

In PERAK, a total of 47 victims from 15 families were accommodated in two relief centres as of 2 pm, namely at SM Abdul Rahman Talib in Batu 4 and SK Sungai Tiang Darat. Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi when met at SK Sungai Tiang Darat said pumps would be built and installed in nine locations in the Bagan Datuk district immediately as suggested by the District Disaster Committee to resolve the flood problem. A flood victim at the relief centre who declined to be identified said that she hoped to be able to return home after having to spend several nights there with her children.

Meanwhile, in JOHOR, the number of flood victims in Segamat remains at 75 from 21 families placed in three relief centres, namely the Kampung Batu Badak Community Hall housing 34 people; Kampung Kuala Paya Community Hall (27) and Kampung Tasek Community Hall (14). The state’s JPBN said that all the victims were from Kampung Seberang Batu Badak, Kampung Batu 5 and Kampung Kuala Paya. It added that river water at Sungai Muar (Buloh Kasap) in Segamat was at the warning level with a height of 8.91m while the weather was reported to be cloudy in several districts, including Pontian, Segamat and Batu Pahat, while it would rain in Johor Bahru and Kota Tinggi this evening.

All the MRCS staff and volunteers in the flood-affected states and districts are still unable to carry out a needs assessment to identify the forms of help and support needed, this is because the staff and volunteers are also stranded, and it is difficult to move due to the flood water level which prevents them from carrying out their tasks. MRCS NHQ will hold an emergency meeting together with the IFRC Malaysia team early today for the purpose of coordinating the response to support the affected states.

name: TZA: Epidemic 2022-11 Tanzania-Anticipatory Actions EVD Outbreak
summary: The Ebola outbreak was reported in Uganda on 20th September 2022 in Mubende District 50 km from the Tanzanian boarder, putting Tanzania at risk of cross-border transmission. The two countries share many points of entry, with people conducting economic activities without any movement restrictions. MOH Tanzania has mapped 10 regions at risk, 5 directly bordering Uganda, (Kagera, Kigoma, Geita, Mwanza, and Mara).

name: BHS: Cyclone - 2022-11 - BHS: Cyclone - 2022-11 - Bahamas - Tropical Storm Nicole Update -01-(11-08-2022)
summary:
The recent update on Tropical Storm Nicole is positioned 140 miles ENE of Hope Town Abaco, 195 miles ENE of East End Grand Bahama and 210 miles NE of New Providence moving at 10 MPH traveling in a West-Northwest with a Westward motion. Hurricane Warnings have been issued for the island of Grand Bahama, Abaco, Bimini and the Berry Islands. 

The Emergency Operating Centers have been activated on the Northern Islands with shelters opened from 9 am this morning. The following is the breakdown of the number of shelters and the individuals who have sought refuge in these facilities:

name: NPL: Earthquake - 2022-11 - Nepal: Doti Earthquake 2022
summary:
A magnitude 6.6 earthquake hit western Nepal on Wednesday 9 November 2022 early morning at 2:12 AM. The epicenter of the quake was located in Dipayal Municipality, Doti District of Sudur Paschim Province, within the sparsely populated area around Khaptad National Park. The tremor was felt in neighboring districts (Bajhang, Kailali, Kanchanpur, Banke, Rukum west) as well as in the bordering area of India.

 

Nepal Government authorities have reported six casualties and seven injured in Prubichauki Rural Municipality, Doti District. An initial rapid assessment shows that a total of 225 households were affected by the earthquake, where 30 were fully damaged. In addition, estimated 15 houses are reported to be affected by a landslide triggered by the earthquake in Bajhang District. Now, affected families are taking temporary shelters with their relatives. The most pressing problem facing the humanitarian effort is access to the affected populations and areas, with roads, communication, and electricity currently reported to be disrupted.

 

Currently, the urgent efforts to address immediate emerging humanitarian needs to provide dignity kit for vulnerable women (who are pregnant and lactating mothers) and further support for elderly people, and people with disabilities.

 

NRCS Doti district chapter immediately deployed the search and rescue team including one emergency response team member in coordination with local authorities in the affected area. The district chapter and subchapter provided 20 NFRI promptly after the earthquake. NRCS headquarter is closely monitoring the situation and communicating regularly with the district chapter and field staff for further assistance.

name: BHS: Cyclone - 2022-11 - BHS: Cyclone - 2022-11 - Bahamas - Hurricane Nicole Update -03-(11-09-2022)
summary:
As of November 9th at 5pm when NEMA (National Emergency Management Agency) conducted the necessary personnel from various Government Agencies. With Tropical Storm Nicole making an its westward trek towards the Northern Bahamas with Alert #21 being issued by the Bahamas Department of Meteorology with it being 50 miles E of Freeport, Grand Bahama, 105 miles N-NW of New Providence and 100 miles NE of Alice Town, Bimini. The Bahamas Government has given an all clear on the Tropical Storm Warnings for the islands of Berry Islands, New Providence, Eleuthera and Andros, however, Abaco, Grand Bahama and Bimini still remain under a Hurricane Watch. 
 
There were 27 shelters activated between the islands of Grand Bahama, Abaco and Bimini, where 520 persons seeked shelter. The team leader for the Abaco reported there was no loss of life and they are still experiencing Tropical storm conditions and have been informed that people should not venture out until an all clear has been issued.

name: PAN: Inundación - 2022-11 - Inundaciones
summary: El día 4 de noviembre el Sistema Nacional de Protección Declara Alerte Verde en 9 provincias (Chiriquí, Veraguas, Los Santos, Herrera, Coclé, Panamá Oeste, Panamá y Darien) debido a un sistema de baja presión y la zona de convergencia intertropical, ubicada al Norte del país, la cual podría generar deslizamientos de tierras y el desbordamientos de ríos y quebradas. El día 9 de noviembre, debido a las fuertes lluvias, que se registran en las Provincias de Herrera, Veraguas y los Santos, provocando el desbordamiento de los principales ríos de estas provincias, al momento hay sectores que no han podido ser evaluados por la crecida de los ríos, el Sistema Nacional de Protección Civil a elevado la alerta a Amarilla en las provincias afectadas por las fuertes lluvias

name: BHS: Cyclone - 2022-11 - BHS: Cyclone - 2022-11 - Bahamas - SubTropical Storm Nicole Update -01-(11-07-2022)
summary:
As of November 7th, 2022 the following NS Brief was developed to report on the exposure and impact of Sub-Tropical Storm Nicole which has formed northeast of the Bahamas. Presently islands in the north west of The Bahamas Archipelago are subject to experience Tropical Storm and Hurricane conditions emanating from this system. The islands Of Grand Bahama, Abaco, Bimini, Berry Island, Eleuthera, New Providence and Andros can be impacted if the hurricane projected path shifts North West.

The center of SubTropical Storm Nicole is approximately 420 miles E of Hope Town, 480 miles E of East End, Grand Bahama, 390 miles E-N of Governors Harbour and 455 miles E-N of New Providence.

Nicole is moving toward the NW near 9 MPH with maximum sustained winds are near 45 MPH with higher gusts. Gradual strengthening is forecast  during the next few days and Nicole is forecast to be at Hurricane intensity by Wednesday or Wednesday Night while it is moving near or over the Northwest Bahamas. 
 
The NS is in contact with NEMA and Team Leaders in each of the islands aforementioned above and the NS volunteers have been engaged accordingly.

name: CHL: Erupción volcánica - 2022-11 - Aumento de actividad Volcan Villarrica
summary: A partir inicios del mes de Noviembre el Volcan Villarrica ubicado en las regiones de La Araucania y Los Rios a tenido un aumento de su actividad volcanica, incluyendo eventos sismologicos volcano-tectonico y de Lardo Periodo que se han percibido en las localidades aledañas al masizo y aumento de actividad termica, por lo que se mantiene un nivel de alerta tecnica en Amarillo por parte del Sernageomin y una zona de exclusion de 500 metros alrededro del crater activo.

name: CHL: Erupción volcánica - 2022-11 - Monitoreo actividad Volcanica Chile
summary:
Volcan Lascar (R. Antofagasta): se declara alerta amarilla para la comuna de San Pedro de Atacama debido a variaciones en los parametros de actividad volcanica del masizo la cual genero el pasado 10/12 una columna de cenizas de 6 km de alto sobre el nivel del crater, se establece perimetro de seguridad de 5 km al rededor del crater.

Complejo Nevados de Chillan (R. del Ñuble): se declara alerta amarilla para las comunas de Pinto y Coihueco por actividad de complejo volcanico Nevados de Chillan, a pesar de mantener actividad baja se decreta perimetro de 2 km de seguridad al rededor del crater.

Volca Villarica (R. de Araucania y Los Rios): se mantiene alerta amarilla para las comunas de Villarrica, Pucon, Curarrehue y Pangupulli por el aumento de la actividad del Volcan Villarica la cual se a mantenido en un constante aumento, relacionada a la dinamica del laog de lava, se mantiene perimetro de seguridad de 500 metros al rededor del crater.

Volcan Lonquimay (R. de Araucania): se declara alerta temprana preventica para las comunas de Lonquimay y Curacautin por registro de actividad sismica y fumatolica en masizo, considerados de bajo nivel.

Volcan Hudson (R. de Aysen): el dia de hoy se reporta sismo asociado a fracturamiento de rocas y a la dinamica de fluidos en su interior, se mantiene alerta verde para volcan.

name: MYS: Flood - 2022-11 - East Coast Monsoon
summary: On 5 November 2022, a flood warning was issued by the Malaysian Irrigation and Drainage Department for the Sg. Golok in Pasir Mas district, Kelantan, affected 4 villages - Kg Kubang Rambutan, Kg Bagus, Kg Degung, Kg Telaga Emas and surrounding areas.  On the 6th of November, the Department of Social Welfare opened 1 evacuation center at Sekolah Kebangsaan Tok Deh in Rantau Panjang to shelter 17  affected  people (5 families)

countries society-name: Red Cross of the Democratic Republic of the Congo
name: COD: Épidémie - 2022-11 - L'épidémie de cholera à BUkavu
summary:
Les détenus dans la prison centrale de la ville de Kamitunga, territoire de Mwenga, sont actuellement victimes d’une maladie mortelle non encore élucidée. Il s’agit d’une maladie diarrhéique semblable au Cholera qui a déjà atteint plus de 30 malades (26 en prison et 4 dans la communauté) dont 14 décès. 
Les malades sont en train d’être acheminés progressivement vers l’hôpital général de référence de Kamituga pour des soins.

name: ECU: Volcanic Eruption - 2022-11 - Actividad Volcánica Sangay
summary:
Antecedente

El proceso eruptivo del volcán inicio en mayo de 2019, se ha caracterizado por emisiones continuas de gas y ceniza. El comportamiento ha ido incrementando desde agosto de 2020. En agosto del 2022 se registraron varias emisiones de ceniza, las mismas que generaron caída de ceniza en las provincias de Chimborazo y Guayas de manera leve y moderada

Actualidad

El viernes 04 de noviembre, el Instituto Geofísico de la Escuela Politécnica Nacional (IGEPN) informó, sobre una emisión de ceniza de aproximadamente 8300 metros sobre el nivel del cráter con dirección al Noroeste. Hasta el momento se tiene reporte de caída de ceniza en las provincias de Chimborazo, Bolívar, Guayas y Los Ríos.

El Instituto Geofísico de la Escuela Politécnica Nacional, informa en relación con la actividad volcánica, que la señal de tremor (vibración volcánica) ha disminuido, al igual que la altura de la nube del Sangay (menor a 3 km sobre el nivel del cráter).

El SNGRE, informó a la comunidad que se encuentran realizando un constante monitoreo en el desarrollo de este evento, así mismo dio a conocer que se coordina con la Unidades de Gestión de Riesgo cantonales y el Ministerio de Agricultura para realizar trabajos de levantamiento de información en las zonas con posible afectación.

name: DOM: Inundación - 2022-11 - Depresion Tropical
summary: Situación Meteorológica y Alerta por Provincias La Dirección del Centro de Operaciones de Emergencias (COE), informa que de acuerdo al boletín meteorológico del día de hoy, de la Oficina Nacional de Meteorología “ONAMET, el cual establece que para este sábado, se prevén nublados desde horas matutinas acompañados de aguaceros muy fuertes localmente, tormentas eléctricas y ráfagas de viento hacia poblados en las regiones: noreste, la llanura oriental, el litoral costero Caribeño, así como, la cordillera Central y la zona fronteriza. Estas condiciones, estarán asociadas a la humedad e inestabilidad provocada por la vaguada en todos los niveles de la troposfera y la onda tropical, las cuales, inducen una zona de baja presión al sur de la isla sobre aguas del mar Caribe.

countries society-name: Belize Red Cross Society, Jamaican Red Cross
name: BELIZE: Tropical Storm Lisa
summary:
The direct impact of Hurricane Lisa comes just 2 weeks after the country experienced heavy rains and associated flooding following the passage of Tropical Storm Julia. According to NEMO, flooding as a result of tropical storm Julia affected roughly 30 communities in southern and central Belize and approximately 3,000 families had been directly or indirectly impacted.

In 2020, flooding associated with the passage of Hurricanes Eta and Iota cut off several communities, with Cayo, Stann Creek, and Belize districts being most affected. Approximately 15% of the total population in Belize was impacted. In response to these historic floods, the Belize Red Cross launched a DREF operation that targeted 5,000 people. The operation supported the distribution of household items, WASH activities and multi-purpose cash Page 3 / 18 assistance.

It should be noted that the recent impacts outlined above were not the result of a direct impact of a hydro meteorological hazard. However, hurricane Lisa directly impacted Belize and so the scale of impact can be reasonably expected to exceed these 2 previous events. Belize Red Cross (BRC) has received reports through staff, volunteers, and the National Emergency Management Office (NEMO) that several communities have been affected. Major areas impacted (hardest hit) are communities in Belize, Stann Creek and Toledo Districts as forecasted by the NEMO and Meteorological services. However there has also been some significant impacts in Cayo and Orange Districts.

Initial close estimates indicate overall 333,549 people in the country were at risk from impacts from the system. According to NEMO, at least 39% of the total population of Belize (approximately 160,000 people) was most affected by Hurricane Lisa. Only in the district of Belize, more than 90,000 people are reported to have been impacted. Among the effects, substantial damage has been reported to property. It is estimated that approximately 500 houses have been completely destroyed, while more than 5,000 houses have been partially destroyed in the Belize District. Partial damage ranged from roofs being blown off, structures being partially destroyed, ground floors being flooded and household goods being destroyed by wind and water. Initial estimates of losses to the housing sector amounts to some BZD 20 million (Approximately USD 10 million).

The Relief Supplies and Management Subcommittee of the National Emergency Management Organization (NEMO) has indicated the need to provide immediate relief to some estimated 5,000 plus families in the Belize District, and up to 1,000 families in the Stann Creek District. The estimated number of families affected in the Cayo, Orange Walk and Corozal districts can reach as much as 500 families.

Food, water, hygiene kits, bedding, cleaning supplies, tarpaulins, buckets, PPEs, power washers, construction and roofing material are the main items needed for the affected population. In addition, further damage and needs assessments (DANA) will be conducted to ensure the most appropriate provision support of affected population. Multi-Purpose Cash will be utilized as a modality for provision of support to ensure dignity, freedom of choice and facilitate livelihood reactivation where markets/business can accommodate.

name: BLZ: Cyclone - 2022-11 - Invest 95L
summary: Cheif Met Officer updated NEMO with the following: comparing the European model versus the American GFS model. Both show the system affecting Belize. However, the Euro has it making landfall on Wednesday evening as a weak tropical storm or tropical depression. The GFS has it making landfall over southern Belize on Thursday morning as a strong tropical storm or even a minor hurricane. It is likely to have a landfalling system but exact timing and intensity is still not too certain. System will likely produce heavy rainfall late Wednesday and Thursday with about 2 to 4 inches per day with locally higher amounts.

name: GTM: Ciclón - 2022-11 - Tormenta Tropical Luisa
summary: La tormenta tropical Julia se desarrolla en el mar Atlántico, con potencial impacto a Guatemala. Se monitorea el desarrollo de este ciclón, que podría incrementarse a huracán categoría 1.

name: GTM: Ciclón - 2022-11 - Huracán Lisa
summary:
El huracán Lisa, que posteriormente se convirtió en tormenta tropical afectó el departamento de Petén, ubicado a más de 500 kilómetros de la ciudad de Guatemala. Los efectos de este ciclón incluyen inundaciones en el casco urbano del municipio de Melchor de Mencos y San José. 

Se reportana a 48 personas albergadas, como consecuencia de 3 inundaciones registradas y 1 deslizamiento. 

La tormenta tropical Lisa ha salido del territorio guatemalteco y se dirige a México.

name: COG: Inondation - 2022-11 - INONDATION COUPLEE AUX MALADIES HYDRIQUES
summary: De cette conjonction de phénomènes naturels favorables à l’inondation découle une classification des événements selon une échelle de gravité, basée sur les hauteurs des eaux et les dégâts dans les départements de la Cuvette et la Likouala dont plus de 3169 personnes souffres des maladies hydriques par manque d'eau potable. Cette situation, met la vie des populations riveraines en danger. Notons que, le Ministère de la Santé et de la Population dans son communiqué rendu publique en date du 28 Octobre 2022 confirme les cas de 02 de choléra et de 3169 maladies hydriques repartis dans les districts d'Epéna, Dongou, Enyèllè et Bétou dans le département la Likouala. Vue l'ampleur des inondations couplées aux maladies hydriques, le Ministère à solliciter l'appui des organisations humanitaires notamment la Croix-Rouge Congolaise pour un appui technique qualifié.

name: UGA: Population Movement - 2022-11 - UGA: Flood - 2022-11 - Uganda – Western Region: DRC Kanungu Population Movement
summary:
The fight in the DRC has accelerated and affected the villages Kiwangya, Ruchuru and Bunanga areas. 

Matanda is a transit area situated in the sub-county of Matanda in Kanungu distrist. The centre has the capacity to hold 800 refugees at one time. Matanda transit area was in the recent past host to 51 refugees who had not been transported to the different settlements. However recent increased fighting in DRC saw an increase of population influx. On Sunday 30/10/2022 a total of 140 refugees were registered that included 66 females and 74 males, bringing the total number of 191 people in the transit area.

On Monday 31/10/2022 48 the 51 refugees previously residing at the transit centres were taken to Kyaka. 78 refugees were registered that included 37 Females and 39 Males, making a total of 221 refugees at the transit centre.

On Tuesday 1/11/2022 a total of 53 refugees were registered, making the total number of refugees at the transit centre to be 274

name: CHL: Incendio - 2022-10 - Incendios Forestales
summary:
Se pronostican altas temperaturas en la zona Central del país entre los días Martes 1 al Jueves 3 del presente mes, lo que hace propicias las condiciones para la ocurrencia de Incendios Forestales, al día de hoy nivel nacional se mantienen 10 Incendios Forestales activos, de los cuales se han controlado solo 5. 

Region de Coquimbo: 

Mantiene Alerta Roja la Comuna de Monte Patria por incendio forestal que ha consumido 185 hectáreas y que hasta el momento ha consumido 20 viviendas y ha dejado 7 personas lesionadas. 

Region de Valparaíso: 

Mantiene Alerta Roja la Comuna de Limache por incendio forestal que ha consumido 2 hectáreas y que se encuentra cercano a sectores habitados. 

Region Metropolitana: 

Mantiene Alerta Temprana Preventiva para la Region Metropolitana por riesgo de incendios forestales. En esta línea se extinguió por parte de equipo de CONAF y Bomberos Incendio Forestal que afecto a la Comuna de Paine y que afecto 9,3 hectáreas y 25 personas damnificadas, 2 lesionados y 11 estructuras destruidas. 

Region de O`Higgins:

Mantiene Alerta Amarilla Regional la Region de O`Higgins por incendios forestales de los cuales 1 se encuentra activo y 1 controlado, que han consumido 194 hectáreas, no se reporta daño a viviendas ni personas afectadas. 

Region del Maule: 

Mantiene Alerta Amarilla para Region del Maule por múltiples incendios forestales activos. 

Mantiene Alerta Roja para Comuna de San Clemente por incendio forestal que ha consumido 110 hectáreas, además se reporta vientos con ráfagas de hasta 20 km/hr. Se reporta por parte de las autoridades proximidad a viviendas. 

Mantienen Alerta Roja Comunas de Molina y Rio Claro por incendio forestal que ha consumido 3.100 hectáreas, además de consumir 8 viviendas, de las cuales 6 se consideran segundas viviendas, se mantiene personal de Bomberos y equipo de Conaf. 

Mantiene Alerta Roja Comuna de Pulluhue por incendio forestal que ha consumido 55 hectáreas y se han consumido 5 viviendas, segundas viviendas y un club social en desuso.

Mantiene Alerta Amarilla la comuna de Longaví por incendio forestal que ha afectado 54,1 hectáreas, no se reportan riesgo para viviendas por parte de la autoridad.

name: PLW: Cyclone - 2022-10 - Tropical Storm 27W
summary: According to the National Emergency Committee, the passing of Tropical Storm 27W was felt by the entire island but highly affected areas were the states of Koror and Airai with higher wind speed. Assessments started after 2pm on Monday, October 31, 2022 and the ended on Tuesday, November 01, 2022 for all the 16 states. Based on the Initial Damage Assessment, a total of 177 households were affected - 13 of them are categorized as Total Damages with roof and walls blown off, 37 with Major damages (kitchen and some part of the household was partially affected), and 127 with only Minor damages and this are considered repairable & livable, for example, living room window was damaged, rain gutter detached.

countries society-name: The Republic of Korea National Red Cross
name: KOR: Other - 2022-10 - Itaewon Crowd Crush
summary: On October 29th, A crowd crush occurred in the narrow streets in the Itaewon. There were more crowded than ever as it was the first Halloween after the government weakened COVID-19 measures. According to the authorities, at least 154 people were killed and 149 were injured. Most of them are 20s, and among them, 26 were foreign nationals. The government announced a period of national mourning until November 5th.

countries society-name: The Trinidad and Tobago Red Cross Society
name: TTO: Cyclone - 2022-10 - Adverse Weather Alert and Riverine Flood Alert - October 28th
summary: The Trinidad and Tobago Met Services issued an Adverse Weather Alert #4 Orange Level and Riverine Flood Alert #1 Orange Level on 27th October 2022. Since Tuesday 25th October, Trinidad and Tobago have been continuously impacted by heavy persistent rainfall associated with the ITCZ and the passage of several tropical waves. Ground level saturation is high creating increased run off into rivers and streams. On a daily basis there has been flash flooding reported in the urban areas since Tuesday. As the major water courses increase in capacity there is greater risk of communities being affected. As of 7am parts of the Caroni River are showing signs of overtopping in typical areas, however mitigation measures such as elevated levees and retention ponds are preventing direct community impact. Many roadways in the southern part of the island near river and stream crossings are becoming impassable as water levels rise in these areas. The Ministry of Education has proactively closed schools today on both islands as a precaution. Isolated reports of homes being impacted due to flood waters are being received, but these are in typical areas that usually experience floods on a regular basis. The TTRCS will continue to monitor the situation as more intense rainfall is forecasted to today into the weekend.

name: PHL: Cyclone - 2022-10 - Tropical Storm Paeng "Nalgae"
summary:
The Low pressure at Eastern Visayas area developed into a Tropical Depression, named as “Paeng” by the Weather Bureau last October 26 which then intensified into a Tropical Storm the following day. Tropical storm Paeng (international name: Nalgae) maintained its strength while traversing the Philippine Sea. Paeng is forecast to further intensify while moving over the warm waters of the Philippine Sea. It is forecast to reach severe tropical storm category within 24 hours and may intensify into a typhoon by Saturday, [Oct. 29]. The occurrence of rapid intensification in the next 72 hours is not ruled out.

The following areas were placed under Wind Signal No. 1 as of 5 p.m. on Thursday, Oct. 27: the eastern portion of Camarines Sur, Catanduanes, Albay, Sorsogon, and Masbate including Ticao Island and Burias Island, eastern Samar, Northern Samar, Samar, Biliran, and the northern portion of Leyte.

name: BGD: Cyclone - 2022-10 - Bangladesh, Cox's Bazar- Cyclone SITRANG
summary: According to Bangladesh Meteorological Department, the Cyclonic Storm ‘Sitrang’ pronounced as “Si-Trang” over east central Bay of Bengal and adjoining westcentral bay moved north-northwestwards over east central Bay of Bengal and adjoining westcentral bay and north bay (Near Lat: 17.8N, Long: 88.8E) with a maximum sustained wind speed of 62 Km/h (rising up to 88 Km/h) within 54 km of cyclone center. It is about 525 km away from south southwest of Mongla port and about 535 km away from southwest of Cox-Bazar port. North Bay and adjoining coastal areas of Bangladesh is likely to experience wind gust/squall ranging from 50 – 60 Km/hr in addition to the heavy (44-88 mm) to very heavy (88 + mm) rainfall. Maritime ports of Mongla and Payra have been advised to keep hoisted local cautionary signal number Seven (7). Maritime ports of Chattogram and Cox's Bazar have been advised to keep hoisted local cautionary signal number Six (6). Chattogram and Cox's Bazar and their offshore islands and chars will be under danger signal number Six (6). All river Ports are advised to hoist riverine danger signal number Three (3). All fishing boats and trawlers over north bay and deep sea have been advised to come close to the coast and proceed with caution. They are also advised not to venture into the deep sea. The cyclonic storm “SITRANG” is very likely to continue to move north-northeastwards and intensify further into a severe cyclonic storm during next 12 hours. Continuing to move north-northeastwards thereafter, it is very likely to cross Bangladesh coast between Tinkona Island and Sandwip close to Barisal around 25th October early morning. Low lying areas of coastal districts: Satkhira, Khulna, Bagerhat, Pirojpur, Jhalokathi, Barguna, Patuakhali, Bhola, Barisal, Laxmipur, Chandpur, Noakhali, Feni, Chattogram, Cox’s Bazar and their offshore islands are expected to be inundated by a storm surge of 5 – 8 feet above astronomical tide. ANTICIPATORY ACTION SYNOPTIC ANALYSIS as of 23 Oct -Most models suggest that it will further intensify between cyclonic storm and severe cyclonic storm with wind velocity of around 100km/hr before it makes its landfall. -Landfall area potential is within west to central coast of Bangladesh between Tinkona (sundarban) and Sandwip islands, near Barishal. -Expected date of weather system making its landfall: between afternoon of 24 October to morning of 25th October.

name: CMR: Epidemic- 2022-10 - Epidemies (Monkeypox and choléra) and floods
summary:
Selon de nombreuses sources, notamment les branches locales de la Croix-Rouge Camerounaise, UNHOCHA et des structures administratives (Districts de santés, Sous-préfectures...), les pluies ont été très abondantes d'où des inondations signalées dans les Régions de l'Extrême-Nord et de l'Ouest. Bien que ces inondations aient causé d'importants dégâts, c'est surtout après les pluies que les véritables conséquences ont été ressenties. En effet, la montées des eaux a entrainé la sorties des fleuves et autres courts d'eau de leurs lits. 

Les inondations rendent plus vulnérables des populations qui vivaient déjà dans des conditions assez précaires (risque de crise alimentaire, insécurité, accès très limité aux soins de santé et à l'eau...). C'est dans ce contexte tumultueux qu'apparaissent encore les épidémies de choléra et de variole du singe. des maladies connues pour leur propagation assez rapide dans un environnement en proie à l'insalubrité. En moyenne, 8 Régions sur les 10 du Cameroun sont exposées aux risques d'une des 2 maladies. La situation s'annonce plus grave en ce moment où une grande partie du pays entre dans la saison sèche, rendant l'accès à l'eau encore plus délicat. La situation actuelle fait état de près de 50 000 personnes affectées par les inondations dans deux Départements de la Région de l'Extrême-Nord ; 23 districts avec 12952 cas notifiés dont 1157 confirmés avec 272 décès liés au choléra. Le Monkeypox quant à lui a déjà touché 8 districts de santé avec 50 cas suspects avec 12 cas confirmés et 2 décès dans 5 Régions. En outre, le pays fait également face à deux autres épidémies dont la fièvre jaune 22 cas et la rougeole 53 cas.

name: Nigeria : Floods - 2022
summary:
Nigeria is experiencing the worst floods in at least a decade, with a widespread impact in 29 of the country’s 36 states. Ongoing floods are damaging homes, infrastructure, destroying farmland and displacing people from their communities. The latest reports confirm that at least 2.8 million people have been affected, at least 603 lives have been lost, and more than 2,500 injured. Two million people have fled or were evacuated from high-risk areas, carrying only the belongings they could take with them, but finding themselves in extremely poor conditions and without sufficient safeguards, exposing them to heightened protection risks.

In addition to the displaced, the country is affected in multiple ways. Goods, such as food and fuel, cannot reach their destinations, as trucks and trains have been stuck for weeks. This market supply disruption will have even greater impact on the already high rate of inflation (23%). People cannot maintain their livelihoods, as they have lost access to farms, livestock and shops. Services such as schools and health centres have been rendered unusable, or if still accessible, are being used as temporary shelters.

name: BOL: Disturbios civiles - 2022-10 - Disturbios por Censo
summary:
La realización del censo poblacional en Bolivia planteado inicialmente por el gobierno para el año 2022, fue postergado a través de un Decreto Supremo hasta el año 2024; hecho que provocó en distintos sectores de la población reacciones de protesta y movilización principalmente en Santa Cruz. En dicho Departamento, las autoridades locales crearon el Comité Interinstitucional conformado por representantes de la Universidad Gabriel Rene Moreno, Comité Cívico, Concejo Municipal y Asamblea Legislativa Departamental que a través de decisiones tomadas en el cabildo convocado y en el que se evidenció una presencia masiva de personas declararon un paro cívico indefinido desde el sábado 22 de octubre hasta que el gobierno derogue dicho Decreto Supremo. Desde esa fecha, se registró varios puntos de bloqueo “pacifico” por toda la ciudad y los alrededores que originó el cese de actividades pero que lo que agravó la situación fue la instauración de una especie de  cerco liderado  por el otro grupo para impedir el tránsito vehicular tanto de personas, alimentos, productos  de primera necesidad e incluso el retiro de basura de la ciudad provocando escasez  y un foco de infección por el almacenamiento de la basura. Asimismo, se evidenció la falta de combustible que especialmente repercutió en casi todas las actividades rutinarias de toda la población, el acceso a sus lugares de trabajo, el tráfico de vehículos especialmente de ambulancias y la disminución de artículos de primera necesidad. Dicha situación generó enfrentamientos entre el sector que apoya el paro cívico y el que está en  contra de estas medidas manifestando que quieren trabajar ya que  son personas que ganan al día.

. En el resto de las ciudades se realizaron esporádicas movilizaciones de la población en forma pacífica con amagues de enfrentamiento, pero sin registrar consecuencias humanitarias por el momento.

name: CAF: Floods 2022
summary:
During the night of 28 September 2022 heavy rains fell on the city of Bangui and its surroundings. They caused the level of the Oubangui River to rise and overflow its banks, causing flooding in the riparian areas of Arrondissement 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, Bimbo and Bégoua. This situation increases the vulnerability of the affected population in these areas who were already facing challenges from the successive floods in July and August 2022, which left more than 21,700 people across the country without shelter and taking refuge in host families, schools and churches (OCHA, August 2022). The rains of 28 September have added to this already high toll despite the mobilization of actors on the ground whose actions since the beginning of the flood season are running out of steam.

The impact of the September 28 floods leaves a significant gap in assistance with many needs. The NS's assessment reveals thousands of houses weakened by water, hundreds of latrines and wells damaged or destroyed by the waters. The loss of material and cultivable land is considerable as the normal harvest season approaches in October. Twenty-two (22) people were also injured. Most of the victims are located in arrondissements 2, 3, 5 and 6, which are considered priority one areas by the government. The towns of Paoua, Kouango and Bambari were also hit by flooding following the heavy rains. They represent the localities most affected by the floods. With homes either flooded or destroyed, populations have moved to host families or schools. The density and frequency of rainfall to date and the continuity of rainfall in the coming weeks made the NS fear that the situation will worsen. According to the seasonal calendar the rains are expected to continue until the end of October (Source: SEASONAL CALENDAR FOR A TYPICAL YEAR, FEWS NET).

name: DOM: Epidemia - 2022-10 - Cólera en República Dominicana
summary:
