Después de más de 3 años sin casos de cólera reportados en Haití, en octubre de 2022 las autoridades nacionales notificaron casos confirmados en el área del gran Puerto Príncipe. El 2 de octubre de 2022, el ministerio de Salud Pública de la República Dominicana, emitió la alerta epidemiológica a propósito del Brote de Colera en Haití, con la cual las autoridades nacionales activan los planes de emergencia con el objetivo de prevenir y controlar posibles casos y brotes de cólera en territorio dominicano. Disponible en: https://digepi.gob.do/documentos-epidemiologicos/alertas-epidemiologicas/. 

El 04 de octubre, el Ministerio de salud inició a una serie de actividades para la contención de cólera en país. El 06 de octubre se realizó la primera evaluación de riesgo de este evento, donde el comité de expertos calificó de muy alto el riesgo de introducción del cólera en el territorio dominicano, debido, principalmente a alta migración poblacional desde Haití y a deficiencias en el suministro de agua potable y saneamiento básico en República Dominicana. Disponible en: https://digepi.gob.do/documentos-epidemiologicos/alertas-epidemiologicas/.

El 20 de octubre, el Viceministerio de Salud Colectiva de la República Dominicana y la Dirección General de Epidemiología del Ministerio de Salud (MS) confirmaron el primer caso importado de cólera. Se corresponde con una mujer de 32 años, de nacionalidad haitiana, residente en Rep. Dom. que ingresó el 17/10/2022 desde Puerto Príncipe, quien inició síntomas el 18/10/2022 con diarrea acuosa, demandó atención y fue hospitalizada en provincia La Altagracia, confirmada por laboratorio con Vibrio cholerae serogrupo O1, serotipo Ogawa. Disponible en: https://bit.ly/3DhfERG, https://bit.ly/3XsM7fB, https://bit.ly/3FqoCvE, https://bit.ly/3WzSTim https://www.paho.org/es/resurgimiento-colera-hispaniola

Desde la notificación del primer caso confirmado el 20 de octubre de 2022, al 1 de febrero de 2023, se han notificado un total de 47 casos confirmados en la República Dominicana, sin ninguna muerte confirmada por la enfermedad. Comunicados de prensa del Ministerio de Salud Pública disponibles en: https://bit.ly/3DwxXBT, https://msp.gob.do/web/?p=16295. 

La última evaluación de riesgo del evento de Cólera en la isla La Española (Haití y República Dominicana), publicada el 2 de diciembre de 2022, evalúa el evento como riesgo muy alto en la isla La Española, moderado a nivel regional y bajo a nivel global, disponible en:
https://bit.ly/3kWEq2y.

El Ministerio de Salud Pública de la República Dominicana inició el miércoles 25 de enero de 2023, la jornada de vacunación contra el cólera en poblaciones vulnerables, con las vacunas obtenidas por el apoyo de la Organización Panamericana de la Salud (OPS/OMS), para evitar la ocurrencia de nuevos contagios y muertes en la población. Disponible en: https://www.paho.org/es/noticias/27-1-2023-republica-dominicana-inicia-jornada-vacunacion-contra-colera-poblacion. 

Hasta el 3 de febrero de 2023 se ha inmunizado unas 6,093 personas contra cólera en los diferentes puestos de vacunación priorizados, con énfasis en los sectores Villa Liberación, El Almirante y La Zurza donde se encuentra el foco de cólera. Así también inició en las provincias fronterizas: Independencia, Dajabón, Pedernales y Elías Piña, vacunándose al personal de salud de hospitales y centros de primer nivel de atención, militares, recintos carcelarios, de los ayuntamientos y los que laboran en acueductos.
Disponible en: https://twitter.com/SaludPublicaRD/status/1621871863801548801?s=20&t=amX0MnylEL5OxoU51kWeaQ.

name: TGO: Inondation - 2022-10 - TGO:Inondation - 2022-10
summary:
Depuis le mois d’octobre, des pluies diluviennes se sont abattues sur la partie septentrionale du Togo (région des savanes), créant un trop plein d’eau au sein des communautés et des poches d’inondations pluviales dans certains villages. La Région des savanes est la zone située à l’extrême Nord du Togo qui fait frontière avec le Bénin à L’est, le Ghana à l’Ouest et le Burkina –Faso au Nord. Elle a une superficie de  8 533 km2 pour une population estimée à 828 224 habitants en 2010. La Région se subdivise en 7 préfectures à savoir : Oti, Oti-Sud, Tandjouaré, Kpendjal, Kpendjal-ouest, Tone et Cinkassé. Sur les 7 prefectures, on en denombre 3 qui sont sérieusement touchées par les inondations. Il s’agit des préfectures de l’oti, de l’Oti-Sud et de Kpendjal

Selon les données de l’ANPC collectées dans les zones en détresse, 18 villages de la préfecture du Kpendjal sont affectées par les inondations à la suite desquelles on dénombre 459 ménages touchés avec 56 cases décoiffées. Parmi les ménages touchés, se trouvent 573 élèves affectés, 531 femmes et une cinquantaine de personnes âgées et plusieurs dizaines d’hectares de champs de mais, de sorgho, de riz, de soja ont été englouties par les eaux fluviales. Dans la préfecture de l’OTI-Sud, 7 villages ont été envahis par les eaux. On note 104 femmes sinistrées, 85 ménages, 138 cases décoiffées et 122 élèves touchés (source ANPC). La préfecture de l’Oti a été envahie par les eaux dans 3 villages tels que  Tambinamoiane, Forêt-Chasse et  Sangbana, 20 ménages affectés, 23 femmes touchées, 33 élèves dont les habitations ont été décoiffées, plusieurs hectares de culture de riz, mais, soja et haricot ont été détruites par les eaux.

Il est à noter que presque toutes les précipitations enregistrées dans la zone septentrionale se déversent dans le fleuve Mono (Région Maritime) qui abrite le barrage de Nangbéto  

La  région maritime, région la plus peuplée du Togo s’étend sur une superficie de 6100 Km² avec une population estimée à 2 599 955 hab. (est. 2010)  est la zone située au sud du pays, entre le Ghana  et le Bénin. Elle compte 7 préfectures (Avé, Bas-Mono, Golfe, Lacs, Yoto, Vo et Zio)

La capacité de rétention d'eau du barrage Nangbeto était dépassée depuis le début du mois d’octobre. Face à cette situation, les autorités du barrage se sont vues dans l’obligation de procéder aux lâchers d’eau pour éviter un effondrement des installations du  barrage. Cela a accentué la montée des eaux dans les différents cours d’eau. De surcroit les pluies régulières après le 17 Octobre, ont crée une montée exponentielle des crues principalement dans le Mono. Ces crues généralisées ont entrainé la destruction des cultures dans les champs, l’occupation des voies agricoles et des dégâts matériels tels que la destruction des cases, l’inondation des écoles, la perte considérable de bétails.

A ce jour, 3 préfectures sur les 7 avec 48 villages dans la Région Maritime sont touchées  par les inondations. Il s’agit des préfectures de Yoto (8 villages), Lacs (18 villages) et Bas-Mono (22 villages) situées en aval du barrage. La préfecture des Lacs a enregistré 18 villages inondés, avec un total de 1093 ménages affectés. On note 119 personnes vivant avec un handicap, 669 enfants de moins de 5 ans, 143 femmes allaitantes et 45 femmes enceintes vivant dans cette situation de promiscuité. En ce qui concerne la préfecture du Bas Mono, les données de l’ANPC confirment 2488 ménages sinistrés, 71 personnes vivant avec un handicap, 881 enfants de moins de 5 ans, 262 femmes allaitantes et 107 femmes enceintes exposées aux risques sanitaires. La Préfecture de Yoto totalise 504 ménages affectés dont 30 personnes vivant avec un handicap, 1789 enfants de moins de 05 ans, 69 femmes allaitantes et 28 femmes enceintes.

name: GRC: Flood - 2022-10 - Flood-Heraklion, Crete
summary: Torrential rainfalls hit the island of Crete on Saturday morning. Homes and businesses have been flooded, streets turned into mud rivers, vehicles have been swept away, bars, restaurants and supermarkets landed in the sea, Agia Pelagia, surrounding areas and Kartetos was hit after 11 o’ clock in the morning.

countries society-name: The Sri Lanka Red Cross Society
name: LKA: Flood - 2022-10 - Flash Floods
summary:
Dear All,

 

Please find below the Situation update on the recent heavy rain (Flash Floods) situation in the country. 

 

The Department of Meteorology announced yesterday 15th of October that due to the low-level atmospheric disturbance in the island, thunderstorms of about 100 mm can occur in many parts of the island. Heavy rainfall of about 150 mm may be recorded in some places of the Western, Southern, Sabaragamuwa, Central, and Uva provinces. In other provinces of the island, heavy rain may exceed 100 mm. 

According to the metrological dept, 243mm of recorded rainfall was reported in Mathugama division Kalutara. 

The general public is kindly requested to take adequate precautions to minimize damages caused by temporary localized strong winds and lightning during thundershowers. 

According to the Disaster management center Level 3 (Red) warning is effective for some localities in the Nuwara Eliya and Ratnapura districts while level2 (Amber) warning is effective for certain other localities in the same sections as well as for Kalutara & Kegalle districts. 

detail information can check from http://www.dmc.gov.lk/images/dmcreports/Situation_Report_on_2022__1665796686.pdf

DMC web link.  

 

Impact of the Situation

As per the DMC situation report (2022 at 0600hrs on 15th October) 11 districts were affected. Out of that Gampaha & Colombo districts recorded more damages. As per the DMC report, 5212 families and 21,888 persons were affected. Out of that 64 families and 264 persons were displaced. The government runs 04 camps for them.

A total of 117 houses were partially damaged and 02 houses were fully damaged. At the same time, 02 deaths were reported.

 

SLRCS branch interventions

 

  • Colombo and Gampaha doing the 24 assessments in the field and other all-district branches in the areas of heavy rains are on standby for response and maintain regular contact with the HQ for further advice.

name: TUR: Other - 2022-10 - Bartın Coal Mine Explosion
summary: An explosion occured on Friday October 14th inside a coal mine at 6 pm local time (5 pm CEST) in the town of Amasra in the Black Sea province of Bartin, Turkey. The explosion caused the death of of 41 miners and left eleven miners injured and hospitalised, while 58 others managed to get out of the mine on their own or were rescued unharmed. The mine was affected at two levels 300 and 350 metres below sea level. Friends and relatives stayed on site overnight, grimly awaiting on news of their loved ones.

name: LBN: Epidemic - 2022-10 - Cholera Outbreak Response
summary: Lebanon is experiencing its first outbreak of cholera in a generation at a time when its healthcare and coping capacity is badly eroded by years of complex crises. The first case of cholera in the region was detected in Syria on the 10th of September 2022. The virus rapidly spread, crossing the border into Lebanon marking the first reported case in Lebanon in 1993. The first case in Lebanon was reported on 6 October, and by 13 October, Lebanon had reported 29 confirmed cases in Akkar and Baalbek Governorates according to UNICEF. By 25 October, confirmed cases had increased ten-fold to 305 per the Ministry of Public Health (MoPH). According to the World Health Organization (WHO), cholera is an acute enteric infection caused by ingesting bacteria present in contaminated water or food. Cholera transmission is closely linked to inadequate access to clean water and poor sanitation facilities. The disease can spread rapidly, depending on the frequency of exposure, the exposed population, and the setting. Symptoms vary from mild to severe diarrhea, vomiting, and dehydration (Center for Disease Control and Prevention, 2020). Cholera affects both children and adults and can be fatal if untreated. However, it is an easily treatable disease. Most people can be treated successfully through prompt administration of oral rehydration solution.

name: SSD: Anticipatory Actions for EVD Outbreak
summary:
As of 10 October, 54 EVD cases have been confirmed in Uganda, including 9 health care workers according to the Ministry of Health. A total of 39 deaths (19 confirmed and 20 probable) have been declared, with a case fatality rate of 35%). Some 16 suspected cases are also currently admitted at hospital, with a cumulative 1,110 contacts of which 668 are being followed-up.

During the last National task force meeting, it was highlighted that a case had moved from Mubende to Kampala and died in Kiruddu hospital in Kampala, prepared by family members and repatriated back to Mubende for burial.

There is spread of the virus across Uganda, reaching the Capital city, which has major transportation route into Juba, with daily traffic for economic and cultural reasons. This means there is need to ensure readiness of Red Cross Teams and provide communities with much needed information on how to prevent the spread of EVD.

The rapid spread of EVD in Uganda with a case fatality rate of 35%, coupled with the fact that there is no vaccine yet for this lesser known strain of the Ebola Virus, are the main reasons for South Sudan RC to revamp its preparedness work. In addition, since the 2018-2019 trainings, volunteers trained in SDB, RCCE and other key EVD preparedness and response pillars have not received refreshers which are now much needed. This will help to restructure the various teams for community surveillance and case detection.

Suspected cases were detected in South Sudan on 30th September and declared negative after testing at the Juba Teaching Hospital. However, given the porous borders between Uganda and South Sudan, and the regular economic and cultural exchanges, it is uncertain how long it will be before a case is declared, or if a case will be declared. This is the main reason it is necessary to ensure readiness and preparedness in a speedy manner.

name: BLZ: Cyclone - 2022-10 - Tropical Cyclone 13
summary:
Update from the Chief Met Office today through NEMO:
The system is now potential tropical cyclone 13. The most likely path is for the center to make landfall on Nicaragua and then move across to Honduras while weakening rapidly over the mountainous terrain. In that case it won't be a strong wind producer for Belize but will likely still produce heavy rainfall with potential flooding especially over the south. Rainfall forecast to peak on Monday with daily totals of 4 to 6 inches and locally higher amounts. Worse case, but less likely scenario, is the center moving on the northern edge of the cone. In that case Belize could be dealing with a hurricane making landfall late on Monday on the country. Will provide another update later today.

name: SLV: Ciclón - 2022-10 - Tormenta Tropical Julia
summary: Se espera que la tormenta tropical Julia Ingrese a El SAlvadoren la madrugada del dia lunes 10 de octubre con vientos entre 50 y 70 kilometros por hora y una banda de humedad que dejara en el pais inundaciones y susceptibilidad a deslizamientos, se han habilitado de forma preventiva 63 albergues y unidades tacticas operativas de el pais listas para cualquier emergencia. se espera estas condiciones afecten a unas 500000 en la zona costera del pais y zona paracentral..

name: GUATEMALA: Tropical Storm Julia (EAP)
summary:
La tormenta tropical Julia se ha degradado a Depresión Tropical y se encuentra en territorio guatemalteco, afectando desde el domingo 9 de octubre, a los departamentos de Izabal, Petén, Alta Verapaz, Chiquimula, Guatemala. 

En las próximas horas se espera que el impacto se extienda a la región de la costa sur del país, que afectará a los departamentos de Escuintla, Jutiapa, Santa Rosa, Suchitepéquez, Retalhuleu, Quetzaltenango y San Marcos. 

El Gobierno de Guatemala ha declarado estado de calamidad, el cual será publicado en las próximas horas en el Diario Oficial.

name: PAN: Inundación pluvial / riada - 2022-10 - Eventos lluviosos y potencial formacion de ciclon (Depresion #13)
summary: A las 11:00 hrs (UTC –5:00) del 06 de octubre de 2022, la Dirección de Hidrometeorología de la Empresa de Transmisión Eléctrica (ETESA) de Panamá, emitió Aviso de Vigilancia por la Depresión Tropical #13, debido a potencial de formación de ciclón, actualmente con vientos sostenidos máx. de 56 Km/h. • Se pronostica su movimiento hacia el norte de las costas caribeñas de Panamá. • Según los modelos de monitoreo, se esperan sobre el país, a partir del viernes 07 de octubre, eventos lluviosos de importancia con alto potencial a generar inundaciones y/o deslizamientos de tierra, por el alto volumen de lluvia diaria acumulada. • Se pronostica que el acumulado de lluvia en áreas montañosas supere los 100mm por día, lo que puede causar en ríos y afluentes crecidas repentinas amenazantes a la vida e infraestructuras. • El Sistema Nacional de Protección Civil (SINAPROC) ha emitido una declaratoria de ALERTA VERDE en todo el territorio nacional debido a los pronósticos de eventos lluviosos, los cuales van a coincidir con mareas altas, pudiendo alcanzar hasta lo 17.5 pies de altura, entre el 8 al 13 de octubre. • Se ha instado a la población a no asistir a senderos, ríos, quebradas, lagos y playas durante la declaratoria de la alerta. • El sistema es igualmente monitoreado por la NOAA, pronosticando lluvias fuertes e inundaciones repentinas y deslizamientos en America Central este fin de semana, por el progreso del sistema en vigilancia.

name: KEN: Anticipatory Actions - EVD Outbreak
summary:
Since 20th September, Uganda MoH declared an outbreak of Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) in the district of Mubende. As of 2nd October, the outbreak has spread to 5 districts with 43 cases of which 20 are probable and 9 confirmed deaths.

Based on the above, it is unsure if or when a case could be detected in Kenya. However, it is key to engage in readiness and early actions to ensure Kenya Red Cross teams in the at-risk locations are ready to act if necessary.

Following the EVD outbreak in neighbouring Uganda, the Kenya Ministry of Health has issued an alert to all counties across the country. This comes after an alert forwarded by the Ugandan government to Kenya in line with the East African Community Health Protocol. The outbreak of EVD in Uganda poses a significant threat to the country as the frequency of Ebola outbreaks in Uganda has taken a unique pattern in recent times. The current outbreak is vigorously spreading and has a high case fatality (20.9%).

Kenya carries out routine surveillance with zero reporting on Viral Hemorrhagic Fever (VHFs) for the moment. This is an acknowledgment of the risk of EVD outbreaks that the country faces as it has similar vulnerabilities to Uganda. (population movement due to porous borders and strong commercial ties as well as previous cross-border disease outbreaks. Indeed, Kenya and Uganda have both previously reported VHFs, including Rift Valley Fever and Marburg disease as well as other disease outbreaks (cholera, Dengue, etc.)

name: PAN: Ciclón - 2022-10 - Tormenta Tropical Julia
summary:
• A las 11:00 hrs (UTC –5:00) del 06 de octubre de 2022, la Dirección de Hidrometeorología de la Empresa de Transmisión Eléctrica (ETESA) de Panamá, emitió Aviso de Vigilancia por la Depresión Tropical #13, debido a potencial de formación de ciclón, con la declaratoria de ALERTA VERDE para todo el país.
  • Para las 10:00 hrs (UTC –5:00) del 07 de octubre, se declara la Tormenta Tropical Julia, y el Sistema Nacional de Protección Civil emite declaratoria de ALERTA AMARILLA para 8 provincias y 2 comarcas.
  • En horas de la tarde del viernes 07 de octubre, se reportan múltiples áreas de la provincia de Colón afectadas por inundaciones. Los sectores reportados al momento incluyen la Zona Libre de Colon, Ave. Amador Guerrero en calle 4 y 5, Villas del Caribe, San Judas, Las Mercedes Costa Arriba, La Verbena, 4 Altos, Villa Los Angeles, siendo este ultimo sector donde se reporta un deslizamiento de tierra que afecta una residencia dejando tres (3) personas sepultadas.
  • Voluntarios de Cruz Roja Panameña y personal de la Fuerza de Tarea Conjunta logran rescatar con vida a una de las víctimas, mientras que otra persona se declara fallecida en el lugar. La tercera victima fue auxiliada por los vecinos de la comunidad, pero aun no habia sido ubicada.
  • Se pronostica que Julia se fortalezca en un huracán durante el sábado 8 de octubre. Se esperan inundaciones repentinas y deslizamientos amenazantes a la vida, por el alto volumen de lluvia diaria acumulada.

name: CRI: Ciclón - 2022-10 - Evento Ciclónico Julia
summary:
Resumen de la Situación 
 
El día 9 de octubre el Huracán Julia, ha generado importantes precipitaciones lluviosas sobre nuestro país, afectando principalmente la zona sur de Costa Rica.
 
Según el Informe meteorológico N°6 del 08 de octubre de 2022 a las 21:00 horas, 9.00 pm la tormenta tropical Julia se intensificó a huracán categoría 1 ubicándose para ese momento en las coordenadas 12.5° N, 82.7° O; desplazándose hacia el oeste en dirección a Nicaragua a 26 km/h y alcanzando los vientos sostenidos de hasta 120 km/h.
 
La Comisión Nacional Prevención de Riesgos y Atención de Emergencias (CNE) ha actualizado las alertas sobre el país, declarando alerta roja al pacífico sur y alerta naranja para pacífico norte y zona norte. El Instituto Meteorológico Nacional prevé que mantendremos la influencia indirecta del Huracán Julia con lluvias intermitentes sobre el país.
 
La Cruz Roja Costarricense es parte del Sistema Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo, por lo que integra las principales instancias de coordinación, entre ellas el Centro de Operaciones de Emergencia (COE) de la Comisión Nacional de Prevención de Riesgos y Atención de Emergencias declaró una serie de alertas ante la situación hidrometeorológica.
 
RESUMEN DE ALERTAS GENERADAS
 
Jueves 06/10/22 mediante Alerta 48-22 se declara:
 
ALERTA AMARILLA para:
  • Zona Norte (incluyendo Sarapiquí), • Pacífico Sur ALERTA VERDE para: • Pacífico Central, • Pacífico Norte, • Región Central, • Región Caribe
Sábado 08/10/22 mediante Alerta 49-22 se declara:
 
ALERTA NARANJA para:
  • Pacífico Sur, ALERTA AMARILLA para: •
  • Pacífico Central, 
  • Pacífico Norte, 
  • Zona Norte, 
  • Caribe, 
  • Región Central.
Domingo 09/10/22 mediante Alerta 50-22 se declara:
 
ALERTA ROJA para: 

Pacífico Sur,

ALERTA NARANJA para: •

  • Pacífico Norte, •
  • Distritos de Paquera, Cóbano y Jicaral, así como islas del Golfo de Nicoya. •
  • Zona Norte (incluye Sarapiquí),

ALERTA AMARILLA para el resto del país.

Jueves 13/10/22 mediante Alerta 53-22 se declara:

MANTIENE LA ALERTA ROJA en:

  • Pacífico Sur

Se pasa a ALERTA AMARILLA en:

  • Pacifico Central
  • Pacífico Norte
  • Zona Norte (incluye Sarapiquí)

Se MANTIENE LA ALERTA VERDE en:

 

  • Región Central

Tormenta tropical Julia continúa desplazándose hacia el océano Pacífico

La tormenta tropical Julia se ubica al norte del Lago de Nicaragua y comienza a disminuir su influencia en la región debido a un menor contenido de  humedad y la fricción con tierra. A esta hora se ubica en las coordenadas 12.44° N, 87.18° O, al NO de Managua, Nicaragua; desplazándose hacia el
océano Pacífico a 26 km/h con vientos sostenidos de hasta 95 km/h.
 
Sobre nuestro país, en las últimas 6 horas se mantienen lluvias intermitentes entre débil a moderada intensidad en la vertiente del Pacífico Norte con  montos 5-32 mm, en el Pacífico Central 80-90 mm y entre 50-120 en el Pacífico Sur. Además, 50-70 mm en las montañas de la Zona Norte. Montos en las últimas 12 horas se registran entre 110-154 mm en el Pacífico Central y Sur, entre 70-110 mm en el Pacífico
Norte.
 
Se prevé que el Julia continuará atravesando Nicaragua hacia el Pacífico y al final de la tarde se ubique sobre el océano, durante la noche y madrugada del lunes se espera esté al sur de El Salvador debilitado como depresión tropical.
 
En nuestro país, continuará con la influencia indirecta del ciclón tropical durante la tarde y noche de hoy con precipitaciones intermitentes en la Zona Norte, Caribe Norte y Guanacaste, así como en el Pacífico Central y Sur, siendo este último en donde continuarán dándose la mayor cantidad de precipitaciones. El Valle Central y Caribe tendrán lluvias débiles e intermitentes durante todo este domingo.
 
Los montos de lluvia en las próximas 12 horas serán entre 10-40 mm en el Caribe y Zona Norte de manera intermitente. En el Pacífico Central y Sur montos entre 40-70 mm en 12 horas y máximos puntuales podrían ser mayores; en el Pacífico Norte montos entre 20-80 mm en las próximas 12 horas; las lluvias también estarán presentes, pero en menor medida al Valle Central con montos entre 5-30 mm las próximas 12 horas. La influencia de Julia se prolongará al menos hasta el día lunes, incluso con un debilitamiento como depresión tropical.
 
Con respecto al patrón de vientos; se pueden registrar ráfagas ocasionales entre 30-45 km/h de viento muy aisladas que afecte a la navegación marítima.
 
Advertencia: Precaución en las regiones del Pacífico Norte y Sur con muy alta probabilidad de inundaciones, Zona Norte y montañas del Caribe, debido estas regiones presentan elevados niveles de saturación de suelos por posibilidad de deslizamientos.

name: Tropical Storm Julia
summary:
Tropical storm conditions will continue this morning over portions of the coasts of Honduras and El Salvador within the warning area. Tropical storm conditions are possible today along the Pacific coast of Guatemala.

Life threatening flash flooding and mudslides are expected across portions of Central America today. Flash flooding is anticipated across the Isthmus of Tehuantepec in Mexico through Tuesday.

(NOAA Hurricane Center)

name: Ethiopia : Cholera Outbreak
summary: On September 16, 2022, the Ethiopian Ministry of Health declared a cholera outbreak in the Harana Buluk and Berbere woredas of Bale Zone, Oromia Region. Between September 17 -20 2022, the Bole zone of the ERCS conducted a rapid assessment which was submitted to the ERCS Head Quarters on September 25, 2022. The assessment findings reveal that a total of 102 cases and one death from both woreda’s had been reported at that time. The key epidemiological indicators, at the time of writing, are as follows: The Attack Rate (AR) for Harana Buluk and Berbere woreda’s are 55.1/100,000 and 24.94 / 100,000 respectively. The Case Fatality Rate (CFR) for Harana Buluk is 1.47% while it remains at 0% fir Berbere. Stool samples from Harana Buluk and Berebere were tested at the Adama Regional lab. 8 out of 8 samples from Harana Buluk tested positive for Vibrio Cholera, while 11 out of 15 from Berebere tested positive. On September 25, 2022. a total of 16 new cholera cases (14 severe) were reported. There were no new deaths. While 2 patients were discharged, Cholera Treatment Centers (CTC) reported 14 new admissions. Anecdotally, the outbreak is also reported to have expanded to the  Dolo Mena woreda. Cholera outbreak response activities are ongoing in both woredas. This includes outbreak response planning (ORP), active case searching, mandatory zero reporting, and alerting of neighboring woredas.

name: THA: Flood - 2022-10 - Monsoon Floods 2022
summary:
The Thai Meteorological Department announced a warning for tropical storm Noru on 23 September 2022 that made landfall over middle Vietnam and moved towards Laos and Thailand. The typhoon hit Vietnam and weakened to a tropical storm, passing through southern Laos and blanketed the lower part of the northeast of Thailand.  Noru hit Thailand on September 28, 2022, causing heavy to very heavy rain  with strong winds in the north, northeast and central regions. The maximum wind speed near the centre of the storm was about 150 kilometres per hour, with the typhoon moving westwards at 20kph. Even before the tropical storm arrived in Thailand, at least 12 provinces, most in the northern and north-eastern regions, were already reporting flooding caused by monsoon rain. The additional rainfall brought by Noru over following the two weeks worsened flooding in several provinces and forced closure of many schools.

According to the Department of Disaster Prevention and Mitigation (DDPM) report on 7 October 2022, there is flooding in 33 provinces (167 districts, 702 sub-districts, 4,069 villages) and the number of affected people accumulated since 28 September is around 87,122 households, 4 deaths and 2 injuries were reported. However, flooding in some provinces eased and currently there is flooding in 15 provinces in the northeast and central of Thailand affecting 79,642 households or around 247,686 people.

The Thai Meteorological Department forecasted that Thailand would expect more rain during 9-13 October, as another moderated high-pressure system from China will extend to upper Thailand and the South China Sea. Isolated heavy rains with gusty winds are expected in the upper country at the first period, then 1 - 3 °C drop in temperature with strong wind is likely in northeast and slightly drop in temperature is likely in north, central and the east regions. At the same time, the monsoon trough will lie across the upper south with continuous rainfalls and isolated heavy rains for the south. More than 762,394 rai or 301,426 hectares of land, including about 504,851 rai or 504,851 hectares of rice fields in the Chi and Mun river basins are flooded, according to the Geo-Informatics and Space Technology Development Agency (GISTDA) released on 30 September 2022.

countries society-name: The Trinidad and Tobago Red Cross Society
name: TTO: Cyclone - 2022-10 - Invest 91L currently impacting Trinidad and Tobago
summary: On 04/10/2022, the Trinidad and Tobago Met Services issued a Yellow Alert for potential hazardous weather related to Invest 91L. The TTRCS participated in a NEOC meeting hosted by the ODPM on 04/10/2022 at 2pm to share operational priorities and strategy to prepare for impact. As on 05/10/2022, 4am, the Eastern end of Tobago and the east coast of Trinidad began experiencing squally weather. Throughout the morning TTRCS has been monitoring the impacts of the system as it traverses the island. As of 10am we have been receving reports of many communities in the eastern part of the island such as Arouca, Arima, Tunapuna, Sangre Grande, Piarco and St. Helena experiencing heavy flash flooding as a result of small roadside drains and outfalls overtopping their banks. This is causing water to spill out onto roadways and into homes. Part of the Churchhill Roosevelt Highway heading east from Trinicity is impassible as there is about 12inches of water on the highway. TTRCS will continue to monitor as the system passes to determine the applicable response as flood waters receede.

countries society-name: Red Crescent Society of the Islamic Republic of Iran
name: IRN: Earthquake - 2022-10 - West Azerbaijan-The Town of Khoy
summary:
According to the Iranian Red Crescent Society, a magnitude 5.4 earthquake has struck northwestern of Iran on Wednesday morning, October 5,2022 at 3:51 local time close to the town of Khoy in the province of West Azerbaijan (Dazaj diz district). The quake that hit at a depth of 10 kilometres in West Azerbaijan province with 30 aftershocks has injured 767 people, and 74 people hospitalized so far, according to the latest information from IRCS. 2 provinces (West Azerbaijan, East Azerbaijan) and 8 Cities (Khoy, Salmas, Chaypareh, Tasooj, Marand, Jolfa, Shabestar andTabriz) were affected by the earthquake.The Iranian Red Crescent Society began its response following the earthquake. The IRCS has deployed its operational and assessment teams to the quake affected areas immediately after the earthquake. (23 assessment teams). 53 villages were observed by the IRCS assessment Teams. The quake and its aftershocks damaged 200 houses in 53 affected villages. Also, the electricity and water have been cut in some villages.                                                                                      Red Crescent actions following the earthquake:

  • Preparedness of the province of East Azerbaijan and Zanjan
  • Deploying IRCS assessment and Relief and Rescue Teams from the city of Khoy, Salmas and Chaypareh for the primary assessment of the scene.
  • Coordinating the deployment of IRCS helicopters for sending assessment teams to the region.
  • Providing temporary shelter with 90 tents, shortly after the earthquake.
  • Providing 330 Blankets, 125 groundsheets, 140 food package in temporary shelter.
  • IRCS Psychosocial Support (SAHAR) teams deployed to the region: A team with 14 persons

countries society-name: Red Cross of the Democratic Republic of the Congo
name: COD: Épidémie - 2022-10 - L’épidémie de choléra dans la ville de Kalemie province de Tanganyika
summary:
L'augmentation inquiétante des cas de choléra dans la Zone de Santé  de Kalemie à la semaine 39 au cours de laquelle la zone a notifié 50 cas de choléra contre 17 à la semaine 38, soit un accroissement de 66%. L'aires de santé de Kataki (quartier Kataki1 à Kamokolobondo) reste l'épicentre de l'épidémie 32 cas de choléra notifiés à la semaine 39 contre 5 cas à la semaine 38, soit un accroissement de 84,3%.

La situation risque d'être explosive dans les prochaines semaines, avec la coupure du courant annoncée par la société nationale électricité  et le retour de la saison pluvieuse.
	
La situation reste également inquiétante dans plusieurs autres zone de sante notamment Nyemba et Ankoro où le risque de déclenchement d'une grande l'épidémie reste certaine.
En date du 4 Octobre le maire de la ville de Kalemie a déclaré l’épidémie de choléra après 70 Cas enregistrés

name: VNM: Flood - 2022-10 - Monsoon storms and floods
summary:
Rainfall from 19h on 27/9 to 7h on 28/9: The Central and Central Highlands regions have heavy to severe rain, over 200-300mm in some places, of which: T.T. Hue 117-358mm, Da Nang 102-233mm, Quang Nam 112-583mm; Quang Ngai 139-306mm, Kon Tum 127-233mm.

- Flood: The water level of some rivers from Quang Binh to Phu Yen has risen to warning level (WL) 1 to WL 2, specifically at 3am on 28/9:

+ Gianh River at Tan My: +1.44 (<WL3: 0.06m)

+ Kien Giang River in Dong Hoi: +1.48m (<WL2: 0.02m)

+ Ben Hai River at Hien Luong: +1.34m (>WL1: 0.34m)

+ Huong River at Kim Long: +1.57 (>WL1: 0.57m)

 

+ Thu Bon River in Hoi An: +1.53 (>WL2: 0.03m)

Latest data from the government on the damages as follows:

 

+ 02 people died, 01 person was missing in Nghe An (due to rain and flood after the storm; no one died in the storm).

 

+ 62 people were injured (Quang Tri 13; Hue 08; Quang Nam 41).

 

+  160 collapsed houses (Quang Tri 02; Hue 06; Quang Nam 65; Quang Ngai 85, Nghe An 02); 3,364 damaged houses, roofs removed (Quang Tri 168; Hue 419; Da Nang 228; Quang Nam 1,150; Quang Ngai 1,352; Gia Lai 7; Kon Tum 27, Nghe An 13); 7,346 houses were flooded (Nghe An 7,306; Quang Tri 01; Da Nang 20; Gia Lai 16).

 

+ 874ha of rice, 4,455ha of crops, 3,040ha of aquatic products were flooded; 5,372 fallen trees.

 

+ Erosion downstream of Hoc Coi dam (Nghe An), treated; 500m canal (Ha Tinh); 1,000m dyke, sea embankment damaged and eroded (Ha Tinh: 500m; Quang Tri: 500m); 12 dams and reservoirs have eroded canals (Kon Tum);

 

+  2,660m of coastline (Thua Thien Hue) and 1,040m of riverbank (Tha Thien Hue 320m, Ha Tinh 720m).

 

+ 77 schools are affected (T.T Hue 4, Da Nang 25, Quang Nam 21, Quang Ngai 27).

 

+ Regarding boats: 01 boat (Quang Nam), 08 small boats (Da Nang 04; Quang Nam 04) were damaged and sunk at the anchorage.

 

+ 1,724 cattle, 20,292 poultry died and washed away.

 

+ 65 flooded and landslide locations on Ho Chi Minh roads, national highway 49B, 15D, 9D, 14E, 24, 24B, 24C, some local traffic routes and 04 suspension bridges , the temporary bridge was swept away.

 

 

+ 10,510 substations lose power temporarily; localities have been repaired. There is currently one 110kV transmission line (belonging to the 110kV power grid) that has not been restored. Quang Nam province is currently continuing to restore the power outages in 147 communes. 

From 01/10 to 02/10, in the midland, delta and coastal areas of the North and North Central region, there is moderate rain, heavy to severe rain, and thunderstorms with a common total rainfall of 50-100mm. There are regions over 150mm, especially Quang Ninh and Thanh Hoa with 100-150mm, some places over 200mm. Day and night of October 1, there are areas in the North, South Central, Central Highlands and the South have showers and thunderstorms, with heavy rain locally. 

the damages caused by the heavy rain from 9 to 10 October, 2022 has as follows:

 

 

  • 01 dead, 02 missing (Quang Nam), 01 person was injured (Quang Ngai).
  • 1,010 houses were flooded (Binh Thuan 46; Quang Ngai 250; Da Nang 714); 21 houses had their roofs blown off (Quang Ngai).
  • 392ha of fruit trees, 310 poultry (Binh Thuan); 47ha of aquatic products (Da Nang) were damaged.
  • 72 road points were flooded by 20-70cm (District 38; District 3; Hue 01; D.Nang 01; District 29).
  • Landslide buried 1 unit of Ka Tinh hydroelectricity (Quang Ngai).

From 13-15 October, the Central region and the North of the South Central region have moderate rain, heavy rain, very heavy rain and thunderstorms in some places.

This afternoon (October 14), the tropical depression has strengthened into a storm, with the international name SONCA.  At 13 o'clock, the location of the storm's center was at about 14.5 degrees North latitude; 111.2 degrees East longitude, about 250km southeast of Da Nang-Quang Nam province. The strongest wind in the area near the center of the storm is strong at level 8 (62-74km/h), level 10 gusts, moving in the northwest direction at a speed of about 15km/h. At dawn on October 15, the tropical depression made landfall in Da Nang - Quang Nam with the true wind measuring level 3-4, continuing to go inland, weakening into a low pressure area and gradually dissipating. Rain and floods caused flooding in many areas of Thua Thien Hue and Da Nang, specifically:

 

 

- T.T. Hue: 11,200 houses were flooded from 0.3-0.8m deep.

 

- Da Nang: Most of the city center area is flooded from 0.5-1.5m deep, in some places over 2.0m; On the night of October 14, the city cut off electricity to ensure safety. Currently, the roads in the city have basically been withdrawn, and electricity has been restored.

Summary of initial damage due to of the floods from October 13-16:

 - 08 people died (Da Nang 04; Quang Nam 01; TT.Hue 02; Quang Tri 01), an increase of 02 people compared to the quick report on the morning of October 17 (02 people died in Da Nang due to water washing away) on their way to avoid floods on the night of October 14).

05 houses collapsed (Quang Tri 03, TT.Hue 01, Da Nang 01); 33 houses were damaged (Quang Tri 03, TT.Hue 02, Da Nang 28). At the highest point on October 15, 74,533 houses were flooded (Quang Binh 906; Quang Tri 1,690; TT Hue 19,918; Da Nang 47,657; Quang Nam 4,362). There are still 1,500 houses flooded in TT.Hue (from 0.1-0.2m).

380ha of crops were flooded or damaged (Quang Tri 253ha, TT.Hue 23ha, Da Nang 74ha, Quang Nam 30ha); 221ha of aquatic products were damaged (Hue town 145ha, Quang Tri 1.5ha, Da Nang 74.3ha); 60,427 cattle and poultry were killed or swept away (Quang Tri 151; TT Hue 4,600; Da Nang 55,503; Quang Nam 173).

North-South railway, National Highway 1 and main traffic routes have been opened. Particularly, 02 major landslide spots happened in (1) Km32+200/QL9C, Quang Binh province (2) National Highway 15D to La Lay International Border Gate, Quang Tri province.

At 7:00 am on October 17, storm NESAT was at about 19.7 degrees North latitude; 116.9 degrees East longitude, about 600km northeast of Hoang Sa archipelago. The strongest wind in the area near the center of the storm is at level 11-12 (103-133km/h), with gust level 14, moving in the southwest direction at a speed of about 15-20km/h. With the current path of the storm, NESAT will make landfall in the North Central region (Thanh Hoa - Ha Tinh province) expected on October 20, 2022.

countries society-name: Red Cross of the Democratic Republic of the Congo
name: COD: Épidémie - 2022-09 - Recrudescence de l'épidémie de méningite dans la Zone de Santé  de Banalia province de Tshopo.
summary:
Selon le rapport du Secrétariat Général du Ministère de la Santé Publique, Hygiène et Prévention de la Direction Générale de Lutte contre la Maladie, Direction Surveillance Epidémiologique et l’OMS du 23 septembre 2022, vient confirmer la recrudescence de la méningite dans la Zone de Santé  de Banalia depuis la semaine 25. Les aires de santé frappées sont celle de MANGI l’épicentre actuelle, celle de BONGONZA située au Nord-est de la première et AKUMA, toutes situées sur la rive droite de la rivière Arwimi. Pour rappel, cette aire de santé était parmi celles qui avaient enregistré beaucoup plus des cas, soit deuxième derrière PANGA. Mangi est une zone minière comme PANGA avec un mouvement pendulaire de population très fort.
Cette maladie se caractérise par des céphalées atroces, des courbatures, de vomissement et raideur de coud, puis s’en suis la mort entre le 3ème et le 4ème jour. Aussi, nous voudrions signaler que la Croix-Rouge, n’avait pas intervenu dans cette aire de santé. Selon le rapport du Secrétariat Général du Ministère de la Santé Publique, Hygiène et Prévention de la Direction Générale de Lutte contre la Maladie, Direction Surveillance Epidémiologique et l’OMS du 23 septembre 2022.

name: SLV: Inundación - 2022-09 - EL SALVADOR ALERTA ESTRATIFICADA POR LLUVIAS
summary:
l Director General de Protección Civil, basado en el Informe Especial Meteorológico No. 12, que indica que la Zona de Convergencia Intertropical (ZCIT) se mantiene sobre Centroamérica, además se observa un sistema que tiene probabilidad de que se desarrolle lentamente en ciclón tropical, emitido por la Dirección General del Observatorio de Amenazas del Ministerio de Medio y Recursos Naturales.

 

Por lo anterior, el Director General de Protección Civil toma las siguientes medidas inmediatas: deja sin efecto las Alertas Vigentes emitidas el pasado 20 de septiembre del corriente año y se declara en ALERTA ROJA en los lugares que se han tenido más afectaciones, según el Centro de Operaciones de Emergencia Nacional, tales como: Cuscatancingo, Ayutuxtepeque, Santo Tomás, Santiago Texacuangos, Rosario de Mora, Ilopango, Nejapa, Santa Ana, Tacuba, Concepción de Ataco, Apaneca, Cuisnahuat, La Palma, San Francisco Morazán, Tejutla, Dulce Nombre de María, Concepción Quezaltepeque, Comalapa, Colón, Santa Tecla, Comasagua, Talnique, Chiltiupán, Zaragoza, San Salvador, Panchimalco, Huizúcar y San Miguel; y ALERTA NARANJA para el resto de municipios del país.

En consecuencia, todas las Comisiones Municipales y Departamentales de Protección Civil, deberán mantener activos los Centros de Operaciones de Emergencia y los equipos Técnico Sectoriales de: Servicios de Emergencia, Seguridad, Infraestructura y Logística. Además, se activan los equipos Técnicos de Albergues, y la Comisión Técnica Sectorial Técnica Científica.

Todas deberán mantener informado al Centro de Operaciones de Emergencia Nacional de las operaciones que se realicen en su jurisdicción y deberán mantener vigilancia en las zonas donde ya se presentaron afectaciones, tomando las medidas y restricciones necesarias, en función de salvaguardar la integridad física de las personas.

Además, se instruye a la Comisiones Municipales de Protección Civil, Prevención y Mitigación de Desastres, lo siguiente:

Activar los Centros de Operaciones Municipales.
Monitoreo permanente de las áreas de riesgo de su municipio.
Seguimiento y control de las emergencias de su municipio.
Activar procedimiento y protocolos de emergencias.
Mantener comunicación permanente con la Comisión Departamental de Protección Civil, según jurisdicción.
Integrar los Equipos Técnicos Sectoriales, siguientes: Monitoreo y Alerta, Servicios de Emergencia, Albergues Temporales, Seguridad, Infraestructura y Servicios Básicos, Salud y Logística.
Integración de Equipos de Respuesta Rápida, integradas por: Referente Municipal de Protección Civil, Referente de una Institución de socorro, Líder comunitario, Referentes de Policía Nacional Civil, entre otros, según necesidad y disponibilidad de recursos.
Distribución en puntos estratégicos de los Equipos de Respuesta Rápida, en áreas susceptible a movimientos de laderas e inundaciones, con el fin de implementar acciones de intervención, de forma oportuna e inmediata, como: evacuaciones preventivas y traslado a albergues temporales.
Mantener informada a las comunidades sobre las condiciones climáticas y de riesgo según corresponda.
Se indica a las comunidades en general, acatar la orden de evacuación, cuando lo considere la Comisión Comunal de Protección Civil u otras autoridades competentes del Sistema Nacional de Protección Civil.

A la población en general, se recomienda:

Mantener siempre las medidas de precaución en presencia de posibles lluvias, al transitar sobre la vía pública, cuando haya posibilidad de derrumbes o caída de árboles.
Se recomienda a la población y a los conductores de vehículos evitar cruzar ríos, quebradas, canales o cualquier corriente de agua que se genere durante una tormenta y posterior a ella, debido a la probabilidad de arrastre.
Atender las indicaciones y recomendaciones de las autoridades del Sistema Nacional de Protección Civil.
Se recomienda suspender la pesca artesanal al menos hasta el sábado 24 de septiembre.

Al Ministerio de Educación se recomienda adoptar la modalidad de clases virtuales hasta nuevo aviso en todo el territorio nacional.

A los medios de comunicación social se les solicita difundir esta ALERTA de manera amplia y suficiente.

name: JAM: Flood - 2022-09 - Tropical Storm Ian
summary:
Jamaica has been placed under a Tropical Storm Watch as of Friday, September 23,2022.The weather conditions for Jamaica is expected to deteriorate with rainfall and heavy winds from the outer bands of the Tropical Storm starting from Saturday, September 24, 2022 going into Sunday September 25, 2022. The center of the storm should pass South West of Jamaica. 

The western parishes are expected to be most affected by the heavy rains. However, other low-lying flood prone areas may be affected by the outer bands of the Tropical Storm. Small craft operators and fishers from the cays and banks have been urged to move inland take the necessary precautionary measures to secure themselves and equipment.

name: UGANDA - Ebola Virus Disease Outbreak - 2022
summary:
In a statement issued on 20 September 2022, the Ministry of Health, notified a positive case of Ebola virus disease which indicates outbreak of the Sudan strain of Ebola virus disease (EVD) [GE1] [DKM2] in the district of Mubende. Ebola virus, part of the class of filoviridae, has multiple strains, of which the Zaire and Sudan strains are the most common.

On the 15 September 2022, one suspected case-patient of Viral Haemorrhagic Fever (VHF) was identified and isolated in Mubende Regional Referral Hospital (RRH). The suspected case-patient was a 24-year-old male who lived in Ngabano village of Madudu Sub County in Mubende District. Prior to isolation at Mubende RRH, he is reported to have sought care from St. Johns Medical clinic in Katwe cell, Kyatetekera ward in Mubende Municipality on 14th to 15th September 2022 where he was managed for pneumonia before being referred to Mubende RRH for further management.

He presented with high grade fever, convulsions, blood-stained vomitus and diarrhoea, loss of appetite and pain on swallowing. He also presented with chest pain, dry cough, and bleeding in the eyes. While in the isolation unit at Mubende RRH, he developed yellowing of eyes, tea coloured urine and complained of abdominal pain on the 17 September 2022. The clinical team took a sample from the patient having suspected a VHF. The sample was received at the VHF laboratory at Uganda Virus Research Institute (UVRI) on the 18 September 2022, and results released on the 19 September 2022 confirmed Ebola (Sudan strain) infection.

name: PHL: Cyclone - 2022-09 - Karding "Noru"
summary:
At 8:00 AM of September 22, 2022, the low pressure area east of Central Luzon developed into a tropical depression locally named “Karding” by the State Weather Bureau which then intensified at 2:00 PM, same day, into a Tropical Storm.

 

11:00 AM, September 24, 2022, Karding intensified into a Severe Tropical Storm and into a Typhoon at 8:00 PM. At 25 September 2022, 5 AM, Typhoon Karding continued to undergo rapid intensification moving West Southwestward and reached Super Typhoon (STY) category at 8 AM. It continued it’s strength and made landfall on the following areas:

·        September 25, 2022, 5:30 PM in Burdeos, Quezon

·        September 25, 2022, 8:00 PM in vicinity of General Nakar, Dingalan

·        September 25, 2022, 8:200 PM in Dingalan, Auroa (typhoon-category cyclone)

countries society-name: The Trinidad and Tobago Red Cross Society
name: TTO: Cyclone - 2022-09 - Preparations for Adverse Weather - Invest 98L
summary: The TT Met Office issued Adverse Weather Alert 1 - Yellow Level for hazardous weather starting 21/09/2022 at 5am and continuing until Thursday 8pm. We are expected to experience gusty winds in excess of 70km/h and up to 125mm of rainfall. The TTRCS participated in the ODPM NEOC Briefing today at 3:30pm where all stakeholders reiterated their preparedness levels. The TTRCS maintained a heightened preparedness level since the start of the hurricane season and continue to operate in anticipate of impact as several active tropical waves impact the islands and a weekly basis. After the ODPM Briefing, the TTRCS staff were put on alert as to potential impact scenarios and we stand ready to mobilize in the event of any major impacts. We have also communicated with the Ministry of Rural Development and Local Government re: gaps and none were identified. Our support is usually channeled through Local Government. TTRCS currently maintains a stock of 200 tarpaulins, 200 Blankets, 200 Cleaning Kits, 200 Hygiene Kits, and 200 kitchen sets. We will continue to monitor the situation provide updates as needed.

name: BHS: Cyclone - 2022-09 -  The Bahamas- Hurricane Fiona Update- #02- 20/09/2022
summary:
As of September 20, 2022 the following “Situational Report” was developed to report on the exposure and impact of Hurricane Fiona to the Bahamas Red Cross National Society. Presently the most southerly islands in the Bahamas Archipelago are subject to experiencing Tropical Storm conditions emanating from the Hurricane. The islands Of Mayaguana, Crooked Island, Acklins, Inagua, Ragged Island, Long Cay and Samana Cay remain under active watch in the event weather conditions deteriorate with respect to the hurricane projected path shifting North West. 
The National Society is in contact with NEMA and team leaders and volunteers on each of the islands aforementioned above have been engaged accordingly. 

Evacuation: 
Evacuation was done on the island of Mayaguana at 8am, September 20, 2022 with approx. 12 elderly and vulnerable residents. Evacuees were relocated to the island of Exuma.  

Shelter Management: 
Four shelters were activated as of 8am, September 20, 2022.  
One on the Island of Mayaguana  
One on the island of Exuma to house the evacuees from Mayaguana 
Two on the island of Crooked Island 

BRCS Team leaders and volunteers on each of the islands where shelters were activated are providing assistance with shelter management. Registering of person entering Shelter and food distribution 
 
Population densities for each Island: 
Mayaguana – 210 
Acklins -600 
Crooked Island -300 
Ragged Island – 120 
Inagua – 1000 
Long Cay – 20 
Samana Cay 20 

Inventory: 
BRCS Inventory in New Providence can disburse approximately 400 NFI’s

name: HND: Inundación - 2022-09 - LLuvias fuertes
summary: La Comision Permanente de Contingencias; COPECO declara Alerta Roja pata los departamentos de Santa Bárbara y Copán, y se mantienen en ese mismo nivel de alerta los municipios aledaños a las riberas del Río Ulúa (Pimienta, Villanueva, San Manuel, Potrerillos y La Lima, en Cortés; Santa Rita, El Progreso y El Negrito, en Yoro hasta el Ramal del Tigre en Tela, Atlántida), exigiendo así la inmediata evacuación de los pobladores. De igual manera, extiende Alerta Amarilla en 10 deptos. y la eleva en 4 deptos. más del país: Olancho, Colón, Yoro, El Paraíso, Santa Bárbara, Copán, Ocotepeque, Lempira, Intibucá, Cortés, Comayagua, La Paz, Francisco Morazán, Valle. Los departamentos de Islas de la Bahía, Atlántida y Gracias a Dios en Alerta Verde.

name: BHS: Cyclone - 2022-09 - Bahamas - Tropical Storm Fiona Update -01-(9-16-2021)
summary:
BRCS remains in preparedness mode as of September 16, 2022. The NS volunteers in New Providence and the major family islands have been engaged and were advised to ensure an established communication is secured with the Local Island Administrator (Government Authoritative Head responsible for Governments Administration in the Surrounding Islands).

 

The NS has contacted NEMA and advised the Agency The NS is available and remains in preparedness mode and will respond in line with our Terms Of Reference with their Agency under Emergency Support Functions #6 and #13 if The NEOC is activated. 

 

Next week Monday and Tuesday, Sept 19-20  will be key assessment dates for The Bahamas and the NS as the projected path of TS Fiona will be more definitive as it relates to its potential impact to The Bahamas."

 

Warehouse Inventory:

 

Warehouse Stocks accounts for 400 NFI's if needed for disbursement.

name: Dominican Republic: Hurricane Fiona
summary:
The Dominican Red Cross continues its work against the effects caused by the passage of Hurricane Fiona through our territory. This work consists of the prevention, organization and coordination trigger for response and rehabilitation emergencies. The different localities present in the 31 provinces of the country have been involved in the entire process of said action, linked to the Prevention, Mitigation and Response system of their municipality, providing the necessary information for a timely intervention to the families that have been devastated by this climatic phenomenon; and in turn giving the required assistance.

During the course of the impact of the phenomenon, the crisis management room remained in a permanent section, processing the information, continuing with the different branches of the CRD at the national level; coordinating both the activities of the action plan; as well as the uses of the Health, water and sanitation teams, directed by the Health Directorate. Similarly, the comunication with the Emergency Operations Center was maintained, forming part of the system in prevention, mitigation and response at the national level.

Each direction and department of the Headquarters have been involved in the entire process of coordination, follow-up and information.

name: USA: Cyclone - 2022-09 - Typhoon Merbok
summary:
The Red Cross is preparing to respond in western Alaska where Typhoon Merbok struck over the weekend, causing flooding powerful enough to uproot buildings and forcing residents to seek shelter.

With winter’s freezing temperatures expected in the coming weeks, flooded homes and airport runways are a major concern. Air travel and delivery of goods and supplies by barge will halt soon because of the oncoming cold weather. In some remote areas, these are the main methods of getting supplies.

The Red Cross has disaster teams in Alaska ready to offer help and comfort to those affected by this massive storm as soon as it is safe to do so. Disaster workers from out of state arrived in Anchorage last week and more Red Cross teams are on their way to support this operation. Communities have been identified that need assistance and Red Cross teams are working with community leaders to provide help where it is needed most. In Alaska, shelters are run by the government and community groups and the Red Cross is preparing to support them if needed. The Red Cross will coordinate with officials and emergency management to help those affected.

name: NLD: Cyclone - 2022-09 - Tropical Storm Fiona
summary: A tropical storm warning for tropical storm Fiona is in effect for Saba, Sint-Eustatius (Statia) and Sint-Maarten. Fiona is located about 526 miles (846 km) east of the Leeward Islands (Thu Sep 15, 17:00 AST). The center of Fiona is expected to pass 40 miles south of Saba and Statia early Saturday morning. There is a 55-60% risk of tropical storm wind (39 mph), and 15-20% chance of 58 mph, from later Friday evening through Saturday morning. Accumulated rainfall is 4-6 inch, isolated higher amount, risk of flash floods and mud slides from Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon.

name: USA: Cyclone - 2022-09 - Tropical Storm Fiona
summary:
Hurricane Fiona hit Puerto Rico with 75 mph winds and heavy rain, knocking out power to the entire island. Some areas might see as much as 30 inches of rain before the storm moves away from Puerto Rico, and flooding, mudslides and debris are making it difficult to restore power and assess the damage. Hundreds have been evacuated and people are being urged to move to higher ground now. Rescuers have conducted multiple swift water rescues. Public transportation is at a halt and airports and seaports continue to remain closed

In Puerto Rico, the government opens and manages emergency shelters. Reports indicate more than 120 shelters are open, many in schools powered by solar micro-grid power systems installed with an American Red Cross contribution of nearly $1.5 million after Hurricane Maria devastated Puerto Rico in 2017.

Prior to Hurricane Fiona making landfall, the Red Cross prepositioned blood products to support hospitals in Puerto Rico. On Monday, the Red Cross sent additional units of platelets to support patients there. Platelets have a short shelf life of only 5 days. The Red Cross urges those in non-impacted areas to give blood and platelets by visiting RedCrossBlood.org.

Fiona also passed over the U.S. Virgin Islands with heavy rain and 45 mph winds. Many are without power and the main hospital and 911 Center are operating with generator power. Trained Red Cross disaster workers will help with damage assessment when it is safe and are working with officials to determine what help is needed. American Red Cross disaster teams are in Puerto Rico and nearby, poised to resume relief services when it is safe do so.

name: DOM: Ciclón - 2022-09 - Tormenta Tropical Fiona Preparacion Rep. Dom. CRD
summary: En virtud de lo anterior y lo establecido en el artículo 2 capítulo 1, de la Ley 147-02, sobre Gestión de Riesgos, este Centro de Operaciones de Emergencias (COE), Emite ALERTA VERDE ante posibles condiciones de tormenta tropical, desde La Romana hasta Cabo Engaño y desde Cabo Engaño hasta Cabrera

name: COL: Inundación pluvial / riada - 2022-09 - Segunda Temporada de Lluvias
summary:
Colombia está próximo a completar un año de lluvias seguidas; aunque la primera temporada empezó oficialmente el 15 de marzo, y terminó a mediados de junio, las precipitaciones en gran parte del país no han cesado, y se esperan que continúen hasta comienzos de 2023, esto, especialmente por la influencia del Fenómeno de la Niña, generando efectos de suelos saturados, terrenos inestables y los cuerpos de agua cargados, dando pie a desbordamientos de ríos y quebradas, creando efectos complejos en las infraestructuras comunitaria y familiar; principalmente viviendas, acueductos, puentes, vías, centros de salud, cultivos e instituciones educativas.  Boletín informativo oficial UNGRD aqui.

La primera Temporada de Lluvias recrudeció el panorama en gran parte de Colombia. En el país se registra un incremento en los niveles de los ríos, disminución de las temperaturas, aumento de enfermedades respiratorias e inundaciones, por lo que se prevee que esta segunda temporada de lluvias recrudezca el impacto a nivel nacional.

Además de estar influenciada por el fenómeno de La Niña, es importante tener en cuenta que esta segunda Temporada de Lluvias también tendrá incidencia de la Temporada de Huracanes que va hasta el 30 de noviembre.

name: KGZ: Other - 2022-09 - Transborder conflict
summary:
According to several news agencies and based on Batken branch field reports, on September 14, a 7-00 morning, in the Bulak-Bashi area of the Batken region, the border guards of Kyrgyzstan discovered a border detachment of Tajikistan. The military personnel of the neighboring country took up combat positions on an undescribed section of the state border. The demands of the Kyrgyz border guard to leave the territory were ignored. Tajik border guards opened fire. In response, the servicemen of the Kyrgyz Republic also used weapons. A shootout began, during which the Tajik side used mortars.

The situation on the Kyrgyz-Tajik section of the state border in the Bulak-Bashi area continues to be tense. This was reported by the Border Service of the State Committee for National Security of Kyrgyzstan.

It is clarified that at the moment the shootout has been stopped.

“Negotiations between the head of the regional department of the Border Service for the Batken region, Kyyalbek Tolonbaev, and his Tajik counterpart are ongoing,” the department reported near 12-00 am.

Starting from 14-00, Batken branch volunteers reported that in the area of Bulak bashi there was a shootout between the border guards of the two countries. There are reports of 2 wounded, military forces are being drawn to the place of conflict.

Volunteers reported that the shootout started at 14-20 in Dostuk village, Batken region. The evacuation began in the villages of Dostuk, Kok-Tash, and Ortoboz. Aksay and Samarkandek prepares for evacuation. 2 evacuation points prepared in Batken city.

By 15-00, we still receive information from volunteers that confirm that the fire shooting continues, and conflict started in the Teskei area as well.

RCSK Batken Branch is in close communication with key stakeholders and coordinating its activities with the Ministry of Emergency Situations, Batken Oblast Administration, and others.

countries society-name: Red Cross of the Democratic Republic of the Congo
name: DRC - 15th Ebola Outbreak
summary:
On August 22, 2022, the Democratic Republic of Congo declared a new case of Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) in the town of Beni, Beni health zone located in North Kivu province. According to the authorities, the history of this case dates back to July 23, 2022 with the hospitalization of a 46-year-old female widow at the Beni General Referral Hospital, who died in respiratory distress in an immunosuppressed HIV-Tuberculosis setting on August 15, 2022 in the Intensive Care Unit of the Beni General Referral Hospital, in Beni Territory in North Kivu Province. A routine oro-pharyngeal swab was performed on August 15, 2022 by the HGR Beni team. The sample tested positive for EVD at the Beni laboratory and was confirmed at the INRB laboratory in Goma. Sequencing performed at the Rodolphe Mérieux Laboratory of INRB-Goma confirmed the Ebola Zaire strain and further demonstrated that this case is related to a strain from the tenth outbreak of 2018 in November in Beni and not to a new introduction of the virus. 

 

The epicenter of the disease is the Butanuka Health Area, Beni Health Zone, in North Kivu Province. The town of Beni is accessible by air and land. It is 52 km from the city of Butembo, 372 km from Goma and about 80 km from the border town of Kasindi with Uganda. There is also an exit road that directly connects the city of Beni with the city of Bunia in Ituri Province and the city of Kisangani in Tshopo Province.

countries society-name: The South African Red Cross Society
name: ZAF: Other - 2022-09 - Mudslides
summary: The South African Red Cross Society (SARCS) conducted joint assessments with government through its local municipalities, disaster management centers at both district and provincial levels. A total of   17 households were destroyed completely and 243 households partially destroyed resulting in a total of 250 households affected and assessments are ongoing. Many families have lost their household items due to the mudslides or had to leave without being able to take them with them. The infrastructure such as water and electricity supply are impacted yet based on the initial assessment, services remain restricted. SARCS continues to actively participate in Joint Operations Committee (JOC) which are spearheaded by both provincial and district Disaster Management Centres to ensure well-coordinated response and recovery interventions which minimize duplication of efforts to same communities whilst other communities are still in need. Several people have sought refuge from friends, family, and other are staying at 3 established evacuation centres. This is posing great risks of the spread of respiratory diseases. Due to the environmental risk from the mudslide, this might lead to contamination of water supply thus increasing the risk of waterborne diseases in the community. Some family members suffered psychosocial trauma due to the impact of mudslides.The mudslide has greatly affected health, WASH, food security and livelihoods sectors and people are struggling to cope with ripple effects which include trauma, stress, limited hygiene materials and food insecurities. Based on above, this DREF request will focus on supporting the urgent needs of affected communities which include psychosocial first aid (PFA), food, hygiene materials, and replacing lost essential household items like kitchen utensils, blankets and clothes

name: BOL: Incendio - 2022-09 - Sta Cruz
summary:
Los incendios continúan y estánafectando a lasáreas protegidasdel departamentode Santa Cruzcomo ser Otuquis(Puerto Suarez),Noel Kempff Mercado (San Ignacio) y el ANMI(área natural demanejo integrado)San Matías. 

El lunes 05 de septiembre del presente año con relación al fuego registrado en Otuquis, se identificó que este incendio tiene comportamiento de sexta generación por lo que las brigadas de bomberos forestales están trabajando con cisternas y carretas tanques que han sido desplazadas, además, el Sedcam (Servicio departamental de caminos) está trasladando hasta Puerto Suárez maquinaria pesada para sumarse a las tareas de contención. informó Yovenka Rosado, directora de Recursos Naturales de la Secretaría de Desarrollo Sostenible y Medio Ambiente. Para el miércoles 07 de septiembre Benjamín Calle, comandante de la Unidad de Bomberos Forestales de la Gobernación, informó que el departamento presenta un 73% de riesgo extremo de ocurrencia de incendios forestales, además manifestó su preocupación por los fuertes vientos y la sequía que podrían incrementar las emergencias. 

Por otra parte, el SATIF (Sistema de alerta temprana de incendios forestales) detectó 226 focos de quemas, en lo que va del mes se cuentan 2.636 focos de quema y el acumulado en la presente gestión es de 20.376 focos de quema. Además, los municipios que presentan mayor concentración de focos de quema son El Torno, La Guardia, San Matías, San José de Chiquitos, Ascensión, El Puente, Concepción, Santa Rosa y San Ignacio. La superficie afectada por los incendios forestales es de 172.526 hectáreas afectadas a nivel departamental”.

Existen 37 familias afectadas en la comunidad de Yororoba del municipio de Roboré, ya que el fuego se encuentra a 700 metros de ésta comunidad, el incendio afecto a su suministro de agua potable, quedando la comunidad sin éste liquido elemento.

name: ARG: Incendio - 2022-09 - Incendios Forestales-Córdoba
summary:
Durante la jornada del jueves 8 de septiembre, el Servicio Nacional del Manejo del Fuego declara 5 focos activos en la provincia de Córdoba al momento de presentar el informe diario, en las localidades de: San Javier (Quebracho), Santa maría (Alta Gracia y Cuesta del Puma), Punilla (Estancia Vieja), Río Segundo (Toledo), Calamuchita (Segunda Usina y Puente Vaca). A solicitud de la Provincia operaron 2 aviones hidrantes y 15 combatientes de la Brigada Nacional Centro, además de helicóptero con helibalde y apoyo de pronóstico meteorológico. 

En este marco, alrededor de las 18 horas se logran controlar los focos activos en la localidad de la Falda, pero a raíz de la rotación y velocidad del viento desde el sector sur que habían avivado las llamas, se solicita apoyo adicional para la localidad de Villa Giardino. 

En la mañana del día 9 de septiembre se actualiza el estado de los focos ígneos activos: Tala Cruz, La paz, Embalse, La Granja y Villa Giardino.

En Embalse, continúa activo el incendio en el sector de La Cruz, afectando ahora la zona de Cañada del Sauce.

Al mismo tiempo, el incendio de La Granja- Ascochinga- La Pampa quema la zona de montaña con un frente de aproximadamente tres a cuatro kilómetros en dirección hacia la Estancia San Miguel.

En Tulumba el incendio fue contenido, con perímetro inestable y personal apostado en el lugar para evitar reinicios. En Traslasierra, La Paz, hay un foco activo de 200 metros que se prevé contener durante la mañana con la actuación de un avión hidrante.

name: COG: Déplacement de population - 2022-09 - Mouvement de la Population de la RDC en République du Congo
UGA: Landslide - 2022-09 - Uganda – Western Region: Landslides and Mudslides - Kasese 09/2022
summary:
URCS 04-hour rapid report:

Subcounty: Rukoki

Village: Kasika trading centre,

Parish: Kigoro 1

Subcounty: Rukoki

Estimated HH: 170

Estimated Houses: 20

Estimate population: 1190

Summary:

Missing 7

Injured 7

Dead 15 people

Type of disaster: Mudslide

Narration:

Heavy rains were characterized by heavy surface flow water started around 1.00am these later progressed into a landslide at around 2.00am.

The heavy surface water flow was flowing though the valley and as it went downstream it started covering up the households in its path.

People started making alarm and running away from their HH. Those that were able to run got away and others were buried in their houses by the heavy rains and soils. The survivors later came back to the scene to look in the morning of the aftermath.

Issues:

·         HH destroyed (partially and most completely destroyed)

·         Children whose parents are missing

·         Bodies still buried under the mudslide

·         Estimated 2km stretch of gardens and crops destroyed. This included beans, matooke, cocoa, vanilla

 

12-hour joint rapid assessment report coordination by Kasese DDMC:

Rukoki Sub County on Tuesday September, 2022 experienced high rainfall intensity from Midnight to around 4:00am characterized by windstorms, and heavy surface flow that concentrated in the valley from Kalingatha Village to Kasika trading centre in Kasika Village- Kigoro I Parish covering an approximate length of 2 km before sweeping the households that happened to be along its way before it joined the nearby Kigoro stream. Onsite it was seen that the subject valley is characteristic of interlocking spers that open in the main valley from the ridges that lie side by side that finally opens at Kasika trading centre. It’s believed that the water brought through the numerous interlocking spars on both sides of the valley accumulated to cause a bigger volume of surface flow that first eroded the top one metre deep of the top soil while plucking the available vegetation cover before it poured into and swept all houses and other properties along its way. Other areas like Kabughabugha with similar physical characteristics were equally affected by the mudslide as it has a very long stretch characteristic of of the interlocking spars in the upper catchment

SUMMARY OF THE DISASTER EFFECT

Type of disaster Mudslide

Cause of the disaster Persistent Heavy rains

Rivers/ Stream flooded N/A

Sub counties affected Rukoki

Villages affected 5 Kasika, Mukathi, Kigoro, Kabughabugha,

Kalingatha

Number of Hhs affected 170

Number of People affected 1,190

Number of Hhs in host families 0

Number of people internally displaced 714

Number of IDP camp(s) proposed 1 at Kogere CoU

Number of Hhs in the IDP Camp 101

Number of IDPs in the IDP Camp 700

Number of crop fields affected (acres) 60

Crops/plants affected Coffee, Cocoa, Vanilla, Beans, Bananas,

cassava, Eucalyptus, maize

Livestock affected Goats, Pigs, Sheep,

Poultry affected Chicken and ducks,

Number of schools affected 1,

Name of school(s) affected Kigoro P/s

Number of classrooms affected 0

Number of worship places affected 1 Kogere CoU

Number of houses destroyed 20

Number of health facilities affected 0

Business Retail shops, the main Trading centre at Kasika

20 Houses with a total population of 140 people from the villages 05 villages Kasika, Mukathi, Kigoro, Kabughabugha, Kalingatha were completely destroyed.

Current situation

WATER AND SANITATION

 20 latrines in the villages Kasika, Mukathi, Kigoro, Kabughabugha, Kalingatha were

completely destroyed. There is a likelihood of diarrhea disease including cholera in

these villages if these pits are not reconstructed immediately.

 One water protected spring (Kamusonge) was completely destroyed

 Kigoro stream was heavily contaminated

ROADS AND OTHER INFRASTRUCURE

 Kigoro-Kasika-Buhaghura 9.01 km road was heavily destroyed

 A section of the power line was destroyed with a number of electric poles

LIVELIHOODS, HEALTH, AND NUTRITION

Over 65 acres of crop fields with kasika village, 30 Acrers, Kabughabigha 10 Acres, Mukhathi 5

acres, Kigoro 20 acres, while 5 acres were destroyed in Kalinghatha village. The harvests from

these fields were mainly meant for home consumption and commercial. The Affected communities will most likely experience hunger due to the poor or no harvest.

As indicated in the summary table, the following crops were affected by the disaster; Coffee, Cocoa, Vanilla, Beans, Bananas, cassava, Eucalyptus, maize, and G/nuts.

Retail shops, and the main trading centre (Kasika) in the sub county was destroyed.

IMMEDIATE INTERVENTIONS TAKEN

 Evacuation of the mudflow disaster victims.

 Carry out onsite visits and data collection by the A rapid assessment team instituted by CAO

 Established an IDP camp at Kogere CoU

 Internally displaced households have been encouraged to go Kogere Church of Uganda for hostage as relief support is being mobilized.

 Psychosocial support is ongoing

 A number of risk areas that are not conducive for human settlement have been sighted.

People in risky areas have been encouraged to get to the safer zones.

 Handing bodies to the families for dignified and decent burial after postmortem by the medical officers

 Share of rapid assessment information with stakeholders at local, National and international levels for rapid response

countries society-name: The Republic of Korea National Red Cross
name: KOR: Storm Surge - 2022-09 - Typhoon Hinnamnor
summary:
Typhoon Hinnamnor was warned to be as strong as the devastating typhoon Maemi in 2003. The government instructed citizens in the high-affected cities around the southern coast to evacuate as early warning before it comes.

The typhoon comes with strong winds and heavy rain and it causes more damage. As of September 10th, 11 persons are dead,3 persons are injured, 1 person is missing, and 5,785 people from 3,785 households were evacuated. A total of 2,332 public facilities and 7,170 private facilities are reported damaged and 19,560 households lost power.

 

The typhoon affects over the country, Korean Red Cross including 10 chapters keep monitoring and conducting relief activities to relieve the affected people's sufferings.

name: AFG:  Kunar and Nangarhar Earthquake - 9 sep 2022
summary: A 5.3 magnitude earthquake on the Richter scale struck the eastern region of Afghanistan on 04 September 2022, causing widespread destruction, disruption to services, and loss of life, to an already highly vulnerable population in Kunar and Nangarhar provinces. The epicenter of the earthquake is 38 km northeast of Jalalabad city, capital of neighboring Nangarhar province. The quake was felt over a wide area, including Kabul, and caused economic losses and according to the Kunar Information and Culture Director, the number of human casualties could rise. Reports from ASADABAD indicate at least 6 people lost their lives and 9 others injured. Mazar Dara area of Norgal district Districts in Kunar province endured the most impact. A rapid initial assessment conducted by ARCS reveals more than 3,000 houses were severely damaged and they have lost food and non-food items and many people were displaced from Noorgal district. Detail multisectoral assessment to determine the exact level of damage is underway, but initial reports show the earthquake also caused damage to health facilities, education facilities, and water services. Support for repairs and rebuilding needs to be fast-tracked because winter is on the way. Afghanistan is still recovering from a massive earthquake that killed more than 1,000 people and more than 3,000 others injured in the eastern Paktika and neighboring Khost provinces in June 2022.

countries society-name: The Sri Lanka Red Cross Society
name: LKA: Flood - 2022-09 - Heavy rains and strong winds
summary:
The heavy rain that started from September 02nd to 06th has caused flooding in a few districts of Sri Lanka. The highest rainfall of 207 mm has been reported in the Lakshapana area in the Nuwara Eliya district. At the same time rainfall of 150 mm has reported in the Awisssawella area in the Colombo district on September 05th, 2022.

The severe weather, including the strong winds and heavy rain, has affected part of Colombo and other districts  The government has declared a miner flood zone from kithulgala to Street in Kalani river banks up to yesterday. Laxapana reservoir opened 03 gates to discharge water to Kalani river until today.

More than 2000 families, including 10,000 people, were affected due the flood. More than 500 people have fully affected their basic things such as drinking water, dry ration, and sanitary items ect.. due to economic crisis in Sri Lanka the government cannot effort or intervein their requirement as previous times and many individuals were requested us to support their drinking water and food supply.

The Department of Meteorology says that showers will sometimes occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, and North-Western provinces and in Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle, and Matara districts. Heavy showers above 100mm may occur in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle, and Matara districts. Several spells of the shower will occur in the northern province.

name: CHL: Other - 2022-09 - Tensión social plebiscito de salida
MLI: Inondation - 2022-09 - Inondation à Bani
summary:
The hydrological situation of the rainy season in 2022 is characterized by the continued rise of water levels on all parts of the river basin except for Banankoro on the Niger River where the level is stationary. As of September 1, 2022, the water levels observed are higher than last year on the Sankarani in Sélingué-amont, on the Baoulé in Bougouni, on the Bani in Douna and Sofara, on the Bani/Niger confluence in Mopti and the level is similar to that of 2021 on the Niger River in Bamako. On the other hand, the water levels observed are lower than last year on the Niger at Banankoro, Koulikoro, on the Banifing at Kouoro and the Bagoé at Pankourou. The filling of the Sélingué reservoir continues. 
In addition, the levels are lower than those of 2018 on all the rivers in Sélingué-amont on the Sankarani, from Bani to Sofara and the Bani/Niger confluence in Mopti.
